name: Enduro Bearings Deep Groove Ball Bearing 6903 17 mm x 30 mm x 7 mm
description: Carefully manufactured, highly precise: the 6903 bearings by Enduro Bearings You can choose between ABEC 3 steel bearings (type 1), MAX bearings (type 2) and stainless steel bearings (type 3). ABEC 3 bearings from Enduro Bearings feature 10th-degree chrome steel balls that are twice as round as the industry standard, and manufactured to the highest standard. The treads are made of a 52100 carbon chrome steel alloy that is vacuum-generated and then hardened for extra strength and durability. A high-gloss polish ensures precision and low noise. MAX bearings are characterised by a 35 to 40 % higher load capacity than standard radial bearings. For 20 years Enduro Bearings has been manufacturing them specifically for use on mountain bike shocks. As its name indicates, MAX bearings are fitted with the maximum possible number of balls. The grooves in the races are deeper to accommodate the multiple lateral turning forces at the MTB rear pivot. The stainless steel bearings from Enduro Bearings are based on bearing balls and running surfaces made of 440C stainless steel. This material ensures maximum corrosion resistance in critical applications and environments. Stainless steel has 20% less load capacity than the 52100 chrome steel alloy used in most other Enduro Bearings, but it is far superior in terms of rust resistance. Seals and CRC marine grease provide additional water resistance. If you live in a rainy area and/or you don't leave your bike in the rain, 440C stainless steel bearings are for you. They can also be useful for headsets, as drops of sweat may be a problem there. Type 1: Type 2: Type 3: Type 1: ABEC 3 bearings with riveted steel ball cage for more durabilitychrome steel balls 10th degree = circularity is 10/1,000,000"race grooves made of carbon-chrome steel alloy, heat and cold treated (down to -190° C), minimum hardness Rockwell HRC 62, polishedLLB: widely used seal type made of nitrile rubber with steel insert, in a groove in the inner race (labyrinth bearing), two super thin sealing lips; the outer one keeps out water and contaminants, the inner one retains greaseLevel 3 in the rating of the Annular Bearing Engineer's Committee (ABEC) in terms of manufacturing tolerances and noise development Type 2: MAX bearing (MAX = maximum number of balls, without cage or partitions) with 35 % higher load capacity than standard bearings and reduced ease of movementchrome steel balls 10th degree = circularity is 10/1,000,000"race grooves made of carbon-chrome steel alloy, heat and cold treated (down to -190° C), minimum hardness Rockwell HRC 62, polishedLLU: Seal type with double lip, in a groove in the inner race; particularly resistant to dirt and dust due to increased pressure, 90% grease filling rate (Almagard Extra High Pressure Grease)Level 1 rating from the Annular Bearing Engineer's Committee (ABEC) in terms of noise, manufacturing tolerances correspond to level 3 Type 3: stainless steel bearings with superior corrosion resistance but lower load capacity for use in wet conditionsstainless steel balls 10th degree = roundness is 10/1,000,000"LLB: widely used seal type made of nitrile rubber with steel insert, in a groove in the inner race (labyrinth bearing), two super thin sealing lips; the outer one keeps out water and contaminants, the inner one retains greaseLevel 3 in the rating of the Annular Bearing Engineer's Committee (ABEC) in terms of manufacturing tolerances and noise development 1 x Enduro Bearings 6903 17 mm x 30 mm x 7 mm ball bearing

name: Shimano Ultegra FC-R8000 Hollowtech II Crankset
description: The Ultegra FC-R8000 crankset by Shimano - elegant and powerful The Shimano Ultegra FC-R8000 11-speed crankset is characterised by its outstanding power transfer efficiency and can be easily used on road bikes with disc brakes and 135 mm over locknut dimension. With a uniform bolt circle diameter of 110 mm, four different chainring combinations can be mounted on the asymmetric 4-arm spider, resulting in a wide range of uses. As a Hollowtech crank with hollow-forged aluminium arms and featuring the Hollowtech II construction, the FC-R8000 offers an optimal stiffness-to-weight ratio. The hollow-shaped outer chainring also contributes to this. Last but not least, your road bike will also be visually enhanced by the Dura-Ace-like aesthetics of the Ultegra crankset. optimised, lightweight crank arm design for excellent power transmission efficiencyrevised chainring tooth profile increases the distance to the chain for more compatibility with 135 mm over locknut dimensions and 410 mm chainstay lengthshollow crank arms (Hollowtech)hollow-formed large chainring (Hollowglide)anodised crank arms and chainringsaluminium chainring bolts Hollowtech II Shimano Hollowtech II is a crank bottom bracket system designed to achieve an ideal ratio of stiffness, weight and rotational efficiency. It is based on an integration of the bottom bracket and the right crank arm and works with a 24 mm axle or bearing diameter, which has proven to be optimal in terms of stability. In many cases, the bearing cups are on the outside so that the load is better distributed. High-quality precision seals ensure a long service life. 1 x Shimano Ultegra FC-R8000 crankset (34-50, 36-46, 36-52or39-53 tooth)1 x Shimano crank bolt

name: SRAM Rival E1 DUB Power Meter Upgrade Kit
description: Elevate your road cycling experience with the latest SRAM Rival E1 DUB Powermeter Upgrade Kit, a  crank with power meter (left) version, a game-changer for cyclists who demand precision and durability. Engineered for the road, this crankset is designed with an aluminium axle and crank arm, ensuring a lightweight yet robust construction that withstands the rigors of intense cycling. Powered by a single AAA lithium battery, it boasts an impressive operating time of over 400 hours, making it a reliable companion for long rides and training sessions. This crankset is not just about endurance; it's about accuracy. With a measurement accuracy of 1.5 %, it captures the power (left) with precision, allowing you to monitor your performance closely and make necessary adjustments to your training regimen. It supports both ANT+ and Bluetooth protocols, offering seamless connectivity with your cycling devices and apps for real-time data tracking and analysis. Recommended for use with SRAM DUB inner bearings, this crankset promises a smooth and efficient power transfer, enhancing your cycling efficiency. Whether you're training for a race or simply enjoying a ride on the road, this crank with power meter (left) version is your ticket to a more informed and improved cycling performance.

name: Shimano GRX FC-RX810-2 Hollowtech II Crankset
description: Shimano GRX FC-RX810-2 crankset - 2x11-speed for Gravel riders The Shimano GRX FC-RX810-2 crankset delivers optimum performance on changing surfaces and for different riding styles. Its gear ratio, specially adapted to Gravel riding, helps to maintain your rhythm even on rough terrain. FC-RX810-2 features a chainline that is further out, ensuring compatibility with wider tyres. Of course, this Shimano crank is also based on the Hollowtech II system, which has been proven over many years. Are you interested in the GRX series? Then have a look at our Shimano gravel site . You will find many more products there. the transmission ratio is adapted to Gravel and helps to maintain rhythm even on uneven terrain with wider tyresoptimal gear change for mixed terrain and different riding styleslarger front rangehollow crank arms (Hollowtech)anodised crank arms and chainringsaluminium chainring bolts Hollowtech II Shimano Hollowtech II is a crank bottom bracket system designed to achieve an ideal ratio of stiffness, weight and rotational efficiency. It is based on an integration of the bottom bracket and the right crank arm and works with a 24 mm axle or bearing diameter, which has proven to be optimal in terms of stability. In many cases, the bearing cups are on the outside so that the load is better distributed. High-quality precision seals ensure a long service life. 1 x Shimano GRX FC-RX810-2 crankset (31-48 tooth)1 x Shimano crank bolt

CDX level: high-end version for high loads and best performancesuitable for mud, sand, snow and ice as well as all roadsmiddle guide groove (CenterTrack)high mileageblack anodised Gates Carbon Drive System The main advantages of the Gates Carbon Drive system are cleanliness, smoothness and robustness. Urban commuters as well as mountain bikers, e-bike users or leisure riders benefit from the high mileage. Oil-stained or rusty chains are a thing of the past. Clean: No lubricant means no accumulation of grease and dirt. Smooth and silent operation: no metal-to-metal contact of the chains. Light: The whole system weighs less than a standard bicycle chain. Consistent efficiency: The drive boasts a long service life compared to that of a conventional chain, where efficiency is significantly reduced by wear or dirt. Installing a Gates Carbon Drive Belt Drive requires a specially-made frame, therefore we strongly advise against modifying a conventional frame. 46 tooth: 48 tooth: 50 tooth: 55 tooth: 60 tooth: 70 tooth: 1 x Gates CDX 5-Arm Front Belt Drive Sprocket

name: CeramicSpeed Alpha BSA Shimano MTB Bottom Bracket
description: Get ready to elevate your ride with the Alpha BSA Shimano MTB Bottom Bracket from CeramicSpeed, a top choice for All Mountain, Cross Country, Enduro, and MTB enthusiasts. Crafted with precision, this bottom bracket features high-quality ceramic bearings that ensure a smoother, more efficient pedal stroke with reduced friction. The bottom bracket cups are made from durable aluminium, offering a lightweight yet sturdy foundation for your drivetrain. For an axle type of 24 mm, it's designed to seamlessly fit with a wide range of Shimano cranksets, making it a versatile addition to your mountain bike. Whether you're tackling steep climbs, technical descents, or just enjoying a leisurely ride through the trails, this bottom bracket will provide the reliability and performance you need. Its superior construction and materials are designed to withstand the rigors of off-road cycling, ensuring long-lasting performance and minimal maintenance. Upgrade your mountain bike with the Alpha BSA Shimano MTB Bottom Bracket and experience the difference in your ride's efficiency and smoothness. This is the perfect choice for riders who demand the best in terms of durability, performance, and weight savings. Say goodbye to unnecessary drag and hello to a more enjoyable cycling experience with this premium bottom bracket.

name: CeramicSpeed Alpha T47/86 Shimano Road bottom bracket
description: Dive into the world of high-performance cycling with the Alpha T47/86 Shimano Road bottom bracket from CeramicSpeed, a top choice for track, road, triathlon, and time trial enthusiasts. Crafted with precision, this bottom bracket features state-of-the-art ceramic bearings that ensure a smooth, frictionless ride every time you hit the pavement. The aluminium bottom bracket cups are not only lightweight but also incredibly durable, designed to withstand the rigors of competitive cycling. Its compatible with 24 mm axle type for a wide range of Shimano road cranksets, making it a versatile addition to your cycling arsenal. Whether you're sprinting on the track, powering through a road race, tackling a challenging triathlon, or aiming for a personal best in a time trial, this bottom bracket will help elevate your performance. The ceramic bearings are a game-changer, offering reduced rolling resistance and increased efficiency, so you can focus on pushing your limits. With its robust aluminium construction, you can rest assured that this bottom bracket is built to last, ride after ride. Upgrade your bike with the Alpha T47/86 Shimano Road bottom bracket and experience the difference in your cycling endeavors. It's the perfect blend of performance, durability, and compatibility, tailor-made for the ambitious cyclist. Get ready to conquer new challenges and achieve your cycling goals with this exceptional bottom bracket.

name: Shimano Deore CS-M6100-12 12-Speed Cassette
description: Shimano Deore cassette CS-M6100-12 - 12 sprockets with Hyperglide+ technology With the Deore cassette CS-M6100, Shimano introduces the 12th sprocket for the inexpensive Deore beginner groupset. As with the top component series, the Hyperglide+ shifting aid construction ensures particularly smooth and quiet gear changes, even under load. The largest sprocket has 51 teeth, the smallest only 10, so this cassette is only compatible with Shimano Micro-Spline freehubs. 12-speed Micro Spline: 12-speed Hyperglide+ cassette for fast, smooth gear changes, even under heavy loadfor 1x12-speed10 T sprocket as smallest sprocket, possible due to new freehub construction (Micro Spline)light, stiff Beam-Spider constructionplated sprocket and lockring, painted spider Hyperglide+ / HG+ Hyperglide+ is the efficient further development of the Hyperglide system by Shimano. These are shifting aids and specially shaped sprocket teeth that make shifting to larger or smaller sprockets suppler, smoother and quieter. The system of small rivets attached to the side of the sprocket and milled or pressed-in ramps ensures that the chain is already carried along by the next sprocket during the shifting process before it leaves the previous sprocket. Hyperglide+ is optimised for faster shifting and shifting under load and has a more efficient chain connection, holding power and power transfer when combined with a compatible HG chain. Compared to Hyperglide, the shifting time is reduced by one third and the pedal stroke is noticeably reduced. HG+ enables a completely new chain stability and thus offers a safe riding experience. Micro Spline Micro Spline is an innovative tooth profile on MTB freehub bodies from Shimano. All Shimano 12-speed MTB cassettes with a 10-tooth sprocket are equipped with Micro Spline freehub toothing. The significantly higher and finer toothing enables a stiffer connection between the cassette and the hub body. The resulting increased contact area ensures reliable power transmission, minimises wear and prevents deformation of the freehub and sprocket. 10-51: 1 x Shimano Deore CS-M6100-12 cassette1 x Shimano steel lockring

name: Shimano Tiagra FC-4700 Crankset
description: Tiagra FC-4700 Crankset by Shimano - More riding fun on the road The Shimano Tiagra FC-4700 is a 10-speed crankset with two chainrings for use on road or city bikes. It also features an asymmetric 4-arm spider (110 mm bolt circle diameter), as first used on the Dura-Ace, Ultegra and 105 11-speed cranks. This results in great advantages in terms of the stiffness-to-weight ratio. The integration of the crank arm and bottom bracket (2-piece design) also contributes to stability. Last but not least, the FC-4700 aluminium crank impresses with smooth, stable and fluid shifting, which clearly means more riding fun. pedal harder and ride fasteroptimal balance of stiffness and low weight4-arm crank construction with 110 mm bolt circle diameterfun to ride due to smooth shifting under the most varied conditions" rider tuned" 10-speed shiftingrefined chainring shapeanodised crank arms and chainringsstainless steel chainring boltsnot incl. chain guard 2-Piece Crankset With the 2-piece designed cranks from Shimano, the right crank arm is precisely matched to the interaction with the bottom bracket. This increases the stiffness and keeps the weight low. Further spaced bearings also improve strength and contribute to more pedalling efficiency. The precision manufacturing of the bearings ensures easy installation and low maintenance. 2-Piece cranks share a 24mm axle diameter with Hollowtech II cranks, so they are also compatible with Hollowtech II bottom brackets. 1 x Shimano Tiagra FC-4700 crankset (34-50or36-52 tooth)1 x Shimano crank bolt

description: Shimano XT FC-T8000 Crankset w/ chain guard - An efficient drivetrain for city & touring The Shimano XT FC-T8000 crankset is aimed at all city & touring riders who value high-quality components. name: Garmin Rally XC210 Power Meter Pedals
description: Experience the ultimate upgrade for your road or MTB ride with the Garmin Rally XC210 Power Meter Pedals, a cutting-edge creation by Garmin designed for those who demand precision and durability. These pedals are not just about power; they're about revolutionizing how you ride and train. With ANT+ and Bluetooth protocols, you can effortlessly connect to your favorite cycling apps and devices, ensuring your data is always at your fingertips. The Rally XC210 pedals boast a dual-sided power measurement system with an impressive 1% accuracy, allowing you to monitor your performance with unparalleled precision. Constructed with a robust steel pedal body and axle, these pedals are built to withstand the most challenging rides. The SPD compatibility ensures a seamless fit with your existing gear, making the switch to power-based training as smooth as your pedal stroke. With a low stack height of 11 mm, you'll enjoy a more natural riding position and improved power transfer. Plus, the rechargeable battery means you're always ready to hit the road or trail with minimal downtime. Whether you're a seasoned pro or looking to elevate your training, the Rally XC210 Power Meter Pedals offer the reliability, connectivity, and accuracy you need to push your limits and achieve your cycling goals.

name: Campagnolo Chorus cassette
description: Wear and tear set consisting of Campagnolo Chorus 11-speed cassette and chain. Ultra-Shift™ tooth design: every tooth of the cassette has been made and positioned specifically for shifting the chain or max. power transferreinforced frame for the second and third triplet: high sprocket cluster stiffness, precision and less demand on the chainUltra-Shift™ synchronisation: the phasing of the sprockets allows maximum shifting performance without delays, for speed, precision and quietness even under load Ultra-Shift™ Eleven sprockets that are still more efficient despite reduced sprocket thickness? Campagnolo has achieved this: the shaping of the teeth optimises the speed and smoothness of the chain passage during shifting. With this tooth shape, the stresses acting on the chain are reduced so that it rises faster onto the larger chainrings. The larger sprockets are grouped in threes and mounted on a newly developed aluminium carrier frame. This increases the stiffness by 180 % and the individual sprockets are 70 % more torsionally stiff. Ultra-Link™ The exclusive Ultra-Link™ locking system is the chain's " safety key" for 11-speed drivetrains: the locking pin has been designed to ensure a consistent and secure hold of the chain after locking with the specially designed UT-CN300 tool. Campagnolo 11-speed drive chains are made of a special steel that is 20% more resistant and have a special design of the outer chain plate for faster shifting even under stress. 11-23: Gradation: 11-12-13-14-15-16-17-18-19-21-23 tManufacturer Number: CS9-CH113 + CN9-CH1 11-25: Gradation: 11-12-13-14-15-16-17-19-21-23-25 tManufacturer Number: CS9-CH115 + CN9-CH1 11-27: Gradation: 11-12-13-14-15-17-19-21-23-25-27 tManufacturer Number: CS14-CH117 + CN9-CH1 11-29: Gradation: 11-12-13-14-15-17-19-21-23-26-29 tManufacturer Number: CS15-CH119 + CN9-CH1 12-25: Gradation: 12-13-14-15-16-17-18-19-21-23-25 tManufacturer Number: CS9-CH125 + CN9-CH1 12-27: Gradation: 12-13-14-15-16-17-19-21-23-25-27 tManufacturer Number: CS9-CH127 + CN9-CH1 12-29: Gradation: 12-13-14-15-16-17-19-21-23-26-29 tManufacturer Number: CS10-CH129 + CN9-CH1 1 x Campagnolo Chorus 11-speed cassette1 x Campagnolo Chorus 11-speed chain1 x aluminium lockring

name: Shimano Disc Brake Adapter for 160 mm Rotors
description: Shimano disc brake adapter for 160 mm rotors - adapts mounting standards With the Shimano disc brake adapter for 160 mm brake rotors you can compensate for different standards of caliper and fork or frame. This means that a post mount brake caliper can be operated on an IS or flat mount fork or an IS or flat mount frame. There is also a version for adapting a PM brake to a PM frame, on which only 140 mm rotors can be mounted directly, and a version required to mount 160 mm rotors on flat mount rear brakes. A special feature are the versions " front FM 140/160 on FM 160" and " front FM 160/180 on FM 160" , which are mandatory for the operation of flat-mount brake calipers on the front wheel. The scope of delivery varies from version to version. front IS to PM: Front FM 140/160 to FM 160: Front FM 160/180 to FM 160: front FM to PM: PM 5" to PM +20 mm: rear IS to PM: rear FM to PM: Rear FM 140/160 to FM 160: 1 x Shimano 160 mm adapter Optional Accessories: For rear FM on PM versions:bolts for other frame diameters

description: Brake rotor adapter SM-RTAD05 by Shimano - 6-bolt rotor on a CL hub With the Shimano SM-RTAD05 brake rotor adapter you can mount 6-bolt brake rotors on center lock hubs. This works with all Shimano 6-bolt rotors except SM-RT86 and SM-RT76 because these have an aluminium spider. name: Shimano Disc Brake Adapter for 180 mm Rotors
description: Shimano disc brake adapter for 180 mm rotors - adapts fork and frame to the brake The Shimano disc brake adapter for 180 mm brake rotors adapts different standards of brake calipers and frames or forks. This allows IS brake calipers to be operated on post mount forks and vice versa. There are also versions to adapt IS forks, which only allow the direct mount of 160 mm brake rotors, and IS frames, which are designed for 140 mm brake rotors, to a 180 mm rotors. The same is also true for post mount: Here the difference between 160 mm (direct mount) and 180 mm is bridged. The flat mount versions are intended exclusively for frames or forks that are designed for 160 mm and 180 mm brake rotors. The scope of delivery varies from version to version. front PM to IS: front IS to PM: front IS to IS: PM on PM: Closeout PM 6" to PM +20 mm: rear IS to PM: rear IS to IS: Front FM 160/180 to FM 180: Rear FM 160/180 to FM 180: 1 x Shimano 180 mm adapter

name: Shimano Disc Brake Adapter for 203 mm Rotors
description: The disc brake adapter for 203 mm brake rotors by Shimano - IS to PM, PM to IS and more The Shimano disc brake adapter for 203 mm brake rotors compensates for differences between the mounting standards of the brake caliper and frame or fork. Depending on the version, it can be used to operate a post mount brake on an international standard fork or frame or an IS brake on a PM fork. Furthermore, there are versions to adapt IS forks, which only allow direct mounting of 160 mm brake rotors, and IS frames, which are designed for a 140 mm brake rotor, to a 203 mm rotor. The same is found with post mount: here, the difference between 160 mm, 180 mm or 200 mm direct mount and 203 mm is bridged. name: Shimano OT-RS900 Shifter Cable Housing - 10 Pack
description: Shimano shift cable housing OT-RS900 for modern 11-speed road rear derailleurs - 10 Pack The Shimano shift cable OT-RS900 housing must be used with current road and gravel rear derailleurs such as Dura-Ace RD-R9100, Ultegra RD-R8000, 105 RD-R7000, etc., as the cable is routed between the frame and the rear derailleur in a smaller radius. Standard OT-SP41 housing proves to be too stiff for this purpose. Ten OT-RS900 housings are supplied, each 240 mm long. RD-R9100RD-R8000RD-R7100RD-R7000RD-RX820RD-RX822RD-RX810RD-RX812RD-RX400 pre-lubricated with special silicone grease to ensure smooth shifting The length of the OT-RS900 should be adjusted accordingly depending on the bicycle frame size. This is necessary for optimal performance. The OT-RS900 should be cut from the correct side when adjusting the length. One of the two ends is flare-processed. This flare-processed end is inserted into the barrel adjuster of the rear derailleur and should therefore remain there. OT-RS900 For Dura-Ace, Ultegra, 105, GRX and other 11-speed or 12-speed road and gravel rear derailleurs, Shimano has developed the special OT-RS900 cable housing. It is less stiff than the conventional OT-SP41 housing and is therefore better suited to the tight curve where the cable is routed from the frame to the rear derailleur. Thanks to OT-RS900, problems with the barrel adjuster can be prevented and the rear wheel can be removed more easily. OT-RS900 is not intended for use on the shift/brake lever side. 10 x Shimano OT-RS900 shifter cable housing10 x end caps, sealed, for rear derailleur10 x Shimano long pointed end caps

name: Shimano Dura-Ace BC-9000 Polymer Road Brake Cable Set
description: The Dura-Ace BC-9000 polymer road bike brake cable set by Shimano - more braking power The Shimano Dura-Ace brake cable set BC-9000 for road bikes contains polymer-coated brake cables. The coating, which looks like tubing wrapped around the cable under the microscope, reduces the surface rubbing against the lining and extends grease retention. The result is a higher braking force and more ease of movement of the brake. Also included is a pre-greased outer cover with soft liner (SLR-EV). Combined with the advantages of the uncoated, nano-polished Ultra-Slick cables and the Slick-Lube liner, this results in noticeably less friction for maximum performance and style. description: Universal and extra-long: the Universal Sport XL brake cable set by Jagwire The Universal Sport brake cable set XL has the proven Slick-Lube internal lubrication. The pre-stretched and frictionless cable surface ensures maximum response with low maintenance requirements. The corrosion protection offers long lasting all-weather suitability. The polished brake cable is made of stainless steel. Contains everything necessary for the replacement of the brake cable and housing. name: Shimano Brake fluid mineral oil
description: The Shimano Hydraulic Mineral Oil is a high-quality brake fluid developed for demanding cyclists who value safety and performance. With a formulation based on petroleum distillates, this oil ensures reliable operation under various conditions. It helps optimize your bike's performance and contributes to the longevity of the braking components. Its specific composition provides smooth braking performance while protecting the internal parts of the braking system. Hydraulic Mineral Oil is therefore an essential choice for cyclists who refuse to compromise on bike maintenance.

name: Shimano Mineral Oil Brake Fluid
description: The mineral oil by Shimano - nothing beats the original Shimano mineral oil is a suitable brake fluid for all Shimano hydraulic disc brakes, whether MTB, Road, Gravel or Touring. Since it does not bind water, mineral oil has the advantage over DOT of longer constant quality - you do not have to replace it as often. Shimano mineral oil is available in 100 ml or 500 ml bottles or 1 litre canisters. A funnel bleeding kit M5 , a funnel bleeding kit M7 for the sender unit and a professional bleeding kit for the complete disc brake are available separately. When servicing the brakes, please ensure that no oil gets onto the brake rotors. hydraulic disc brakes from Shimano Signal Word:DangerHazardous Components:Distillates (petroleum), hydrotreated light paraffinic; base oil - unspecified; distillates (petroleum), solvent-dewaxed heavy paraffinic; base oil - unspecifiedHazard Warnings:H304 May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways.H412 Harmful to aquatic life with long lasting effects.Safety Information:P102 Keep out of reach of children.P273 Avoid release to the environment.P301+ P301+P311 IF SWALLOWED: Call the POISON INFORMATION CENTRE OR DOCTOR IMMEDIATELY. name: Magura Royal Blood Hydraulic Oil
description: Royal Blood hydraulic oil by Magura brings safety to braking systems The Royal Blood hydraulic oil serves as a mineral oil-based brake fluid for Magura hydraulic rim and disc brakes. It ensures that you always have the correct brake point in your Magura brake system and that you come to a safe stop. Normally, the system does not need to be bled regularly, as the Royal Blood is not hygroscopic, i.e. it does not draw water, and does not age, thus providing consistent performance over several years. name: Motorex Brake Fluid, DOT 5.1
description: The Brake Fluid DOT 5.1 by Motorex for high-performance brakes The DOT 5.1 Brake Fluid from Motorex is a brake fluid for hydraulic disc brakes. The boiling point is at least 260 °C. The wet boiling point of at least 180 °C is also extremely high. As a result, no vapour bubbles form even under extremely high brake loads, which makes the response enormously fine and ensures high braking performance. In addition, the brake fluid has a low viscosity and is therefore suitable for auxiliary units such as ABS, ARS and ESP. high braking power with fine responseboiling point at least 260 °Cat least 180 °C wet boiling pointsuitable for auxiliary units such as ABS, ASR and ESP May adversely affect paints, lacquers or, in some cases, plastics. May only be filled into systems designed for brake fluids. Avoid mixing with mineral oil and silicone-based brake fluids or DOT 5.1. The change intervals according to the vehicle manufacturer must be observed. name: Shimano 105 front+rear set shift/brake levers STI ST-R7000 2x/11-speed
description: The Shimano 105 ST-R7000 Shift/Brake Grips - Optimised grip feeling The Shimano 105 ST-R7000 shift/brake lever set with Dual Control shifters for left (2-speed) and right (11-speed) provides faster and smoother shifting, made possible by a revised shifting mechanism and shorter lever travel. The ergonomics have also been refined, the grip feeling improved and brought into line with that of the Ultegra models. The integrated braking function (Shimano Total Integration Technology) stands for reliable performance in the SLR-EV rim braking system. The extended grip width adjustment also helps control in the cockpit. The ST-R7000 shift/brake grips come with friction-reducing Optislick shift cables, brake cables and outer sleeves. * with reduced braking force revised shift unit for fast and intuitive shiftingextended reach adjustment (15 mm)Optislick stainless steel inner cable with a minimal galvanic coating for more efficient cable routing and corrosion resistanceOT-SP41 cable housing on lever side, OT- RS900 to rear derailleurSLR-EV brake technologypainted main lever STI Dual Control Shimano Total Integration (STI) means the combination of braking and shifting functions in one lever, which increases safety when riding. By refining the technology, it became possible to make shifting so smooth at the front and rear that they can be triggered with just one finger. Shimano calls such levers Dual Control Levers (DCL). 2x11-speed: 1 x pair Shimano 105 ST-R7000 shift/brake levers1 x Shimano shift cable, 1800 mm1 x Shimano shift cable, 2100 mm2 x brake cables2 x brake cable housings3 x shifter cable housings

name: Shimano 105 BR-R7170 + Di2 ST-R7170 Disc Brake
description: Shimano 105 Disc Brake with BR-R7170 caliper and ST-R7170 Di2 shift/brake lever The disc brake for the 105 road bike groupset from Shimano consists of the BR-R7170 and ST-R7170. These are a flat-mount brake calipers for front or rear and an electronic shift/brake lever that enables wireless 2x or 12-speed shifting and hydraulic braking. The set includes organic brake pads, which contribute to improved heat dissipation with their Ice Tech cooling fins, a brake hose as well as connection material. The 105 R7170 disc brake caliper has 10% more brake pad clearance than its predecessor model. This minimises the likelihood of grinding noises and thus results in a quieter braking process. The powerful, excellently controllable braking power ensures reliable deceleration and brings you to a safe stop in all conditions. You also benefit from the user-friendly bleeding process, also known as One-Way Bleeding. With its flat mount design, the two-piece aluminium brake caliper also blends in perfectly with the overall appearance of your bike. By the way, the R7170 does not weigh more than the comparable Ultegra model. The 105 ST-R7170 Di2 shift/brake lever has an upwardly extended grip bar end which offers a very ergonomic hold. In addition, you can easily adjust the grip width to your hand size with the help of a 2 mm hex tool. Thanks to the increased braking range and the sensitive lever action, you have full control over all braking processes, and the pressure point is also adjustable. At the same time, the shift/brake levers weigh only about 30 grams per pair more than the Ultegra model. Of course, as before with Dura-Ace and Ultegra, the retreaded Di2 platform is used. This means that the ST-R7170 communicates via a wireless protocol with the rear derailleur, which in turn is wired to the battery and indirectly to the front derailleur. This not only means lightning-fast, highly precise gear changes at the touch of a button. By dispensing with cables on the cockpit, your bike looks tidier, assembly is easier and the shifters & derailleurs are insensitive to dirt at this point. The STI is powered by two button cells that last for several years and can be self-replaced when needed. The brake lever is made of lightweight aluminium, the grip body is made of durable composite material. Information on the return and disposal of batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Shift/Brake Lever: * only for pairing via cable or firmware updates, wired shifting is not supported Brake Caliper: Shift/Brake Lever: tidy cockpit, aesthetic look thanks to wireless connectionwireless shifting, precise and fast (rear derailleur / front derailleur with cabling)CR1632 batteries easy to replace with flat head screwdriver, 3.5 to 4 years runtimeunique ergonomics thanks to feedback from professional ridersfunnel venting with M7 funnelfirmware updates via E-Tube Projectanodised brake lever Brake Caliper: 10% larger brake pad spacing minimises grinding of the brake rotor, less noise developmentcoherent appearance and easy tool access thanks to flat mountoptimised heat dissipation with Ice-Techsimple bleeding process2 pistons made of synthetic resinpaintedsteel bolts (4 mm) STI Dual Control Shimano Total Integration (STI) means the combination of braking and shifting functions in one lever, which increases safety when riding. By refining the technology, it became possible to make shifting so smooth at the front and rear that they can be triggered with just one finger. Shimano calls such levers Dual Control Levers (DCL). Digital Integrated Intelligence (Di2) Di2 systems are the electronic shifting systems from Shimano. They are based on the SEIS, the Shimano Electronic Intelligent System, which takes over the index shifting function from the mechanical components, only via power cables or radio signals and not via a Bowden cable. Shifting is done by simply pressing a button. This has the advantage that no great effort is required, your concentration on the ride is not disturbed and operation is easy even with cold hands. In addition, the electronic gear changes are very fast and highly precise. There is also no risk of a defective circuit due to dirty cables or other problems. You can adjust individual settings via the E-Tube Project, such as adjusting the shifting speed, the number of shifting operations per button press or the Synchro or Semi-Synchro shifting function. Shimano offers an app for this purpose. Gear maintenance and firmware updates are also done via E-Tube, with the bike connected to a PC running the appropriate E-Tube software for more extensive workshop work. Semi-wireless The Shimano Di2 12-speed road groupsets in the disc brake version work semi-wirelessly: at the crucial point, namely the interaction between STIs and rear derailleur, the cable is dispensed with, which makes for a tidy cockpit and considerably simplifies assembly. The wireless protocol is extremely fast and reliable, so that the shifting speed reaches a new level - with consistently high precision. Attention was also paid to keeping power consumption as low as possible. Cables are only used between the battery and the rear derailleur and between the battery and the front derailleur. These are thinner than the previous models and easier to lay. Shimano relies on a central battery located in the seatpost. This increases safety and ensures an uncomplicated charging process via the rear derailleur. Once fully charged, the circuit can be ridden for approx. 1000 km. The components are paired together via the E-Tube platform. One Way Bleeding One Way Bleeding is a technique used on Shimano calipers that facilitates brake bleeding. The hose routing has been optimised so that no air bubbles remain in the brake calliper. In combination with the funnel, the brake can be bled cleanly and easily. 1 x Shimano 105 BR-R7170 + 105 Di2 ST-R7170 disc brake, frontorrear1 x Shimano SM-BH90-JK-SSR brake hose, 1000 mm (front)or1700 mm (rear)1 x pair Shimano resin brake pads with cooling fins1 x disc brake adapter for front 140/160 + 160/180 mm (only for front)1 x hose connection sets2 x type A caliper bolts (front)2 x caliper bolts for 25 mm frame diameters (rear)2 x CR1632 batteriesready for installation, filled,bleedingis recommended after installation FM to FM brake adapterSM-MA-R160 D/Dfor 160 mm brake rotor on 140 mm FM frame (for rear)FM-to-FM brake adapterSM-MA-R160 D/Dfor 180 mm brake rotor on 160 mm FM frame (for rear) Optional accessories: K05S-RX Resin PadsL04C-MF Metal Pads w/ Cooling FinsType C bolts for 10/15/20/30/35 mm frame diameterType C2 bolts for 10/15/20/30/35 mm frame diameter

name: Shimano Deore BL-T611 Brake Lever
description: The Deore BL-T611 brake lever by Shimano is a good choice for city & touring bikes The Shimano Deore BL-T611 brake lever is designed for use on city and touring bikes and has a lever in classic 3-finger length. It can be used with V-brakes and mechanical disc brakes. Its smooth operation is just as impressive from a technical perspective as its sporty appearance is from a visual point of view. Thanks to I-Spec (B) compatibility, you can combine the Deore brake lever with a matching shifter to save space on the handlebars. BL-T611 is available in black or silver, individually or as a set. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. sporty appearance with integrated componentseasy to control, easy to maintainsmooth-running and smooth operationT-type brake cableinside stopanodised lever, painted bodystainless steel clamp bolts I-Spec I-Spec enables the connection between the brake lever and shift lever on MTB derailleurs from Shimano. The main advantages are a cleaner look at the cockpit, more space on the handlebars and, of course, weight savings. For brake levers with I-Spec B (as of 2014), there is initially no compatibility with shift levers with the old I-Spec mount. description: The 105 ST-R7020 Shift/Brake Lever by Shimano - Fast shifting, safe braking The Shimano 105 ST-R7020 STI shifter/brake lever can shift 2-speed or 11-speed (with Dual Control technology) and control a hydraulic disc brake - perfect for cyclocross or gravel use, but also for the road when maximum braking performance is required in difficult conditions. Both the revised shifting unit with shorter lever travel and the reduced hydraulics are impressive, with faster shifting processes and a pleasing appearance as a result. The refined ergonomics and generous grip width adjustment also speak for themselves. name: Shimano XT BL-M8100 Brake Lever
description: Shimano XT BL-M8100 brake lever - with additional contact point on the handlebars The Shimano XT BL-M8100 brake lever is mounted at an angle to provide an additional contact point. This increases stiffness and provides more direct feedback. In addition, Shimano Servo Wave increases braking power: more performance is available with shorter empty travel. Of course, the BL-M8100 brake lever is compatible with the I-Spec EV system, so you can customise your cockpit in a tidy and individual way. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. optimised lever axis position with additional contact point and revised ergonomicsflexible, action-optimised cockpit layout thanks to I-Spec EVrotation adjustment angle for compatible shift lever: 20°10 % stiffer than M8000, even when hotfaster braking with less empty pullrecommended brake caliper:BR-M8100,BR-M8110,BR-M8120funnel venting with M5 funnel (TL-BR003)anodised lever, painted bodystainless steel clamp bolts Servo Wave Shimano Servo Wave technology optimises the travel of your brake levers. During the braking process, the brake pads are guided quickly to the brake rotor with very short lever travel. The greater part of the lever travel is reserved for the actual braking force. In this way, you can apply your braking power in a more targeted manner and use it more effectively. I-Spec EV I-Spec EV describes a variant of the connection between brake lever and shift lever on Shimano MTB derailleurs. This type of mounting allows the shifter to be adjusted both horizontally and vertically in relation to the brake lever, and ensures a tidy cockpit by reducing the number of clamps required. Compared to I-Spec and I-Spec II, I-Spec EV offers a much wider adjustment range. 14 mm adjustment range the longitudinal direction and up to 60° rotation allow an optimal ergonomic adjustment to your riding style, your sitting position and your anatomy. 1 x Shimano XT BL-M8100 brake lever, leftorright1 x brake cable cover for brake lever connection setfor brake hose

name: Shimano Saint BL-M820-B Brake Lever
description: The Saint BL-M820-B brake lever by Shimano - full control on the descent The Shimano Saint BL-M820-B brake lever offers top performance for tough Downhill and Freeride use. With its ergonomic, anti-slip 2-finger lever, it always lies comfortably in the hand. The Servo Wave technology ensures that the applied force is optimally converted into braking performance and that full control is maintained even on difficult downhill sections. Thanks to I-Spec (B) compatibility, the Saint brake lever can also be combined with a matching shifter to save space. ergonomic, anti-slip leverfunnel venting with M5 funnel (TL-BR003)recommended brake caliper:BR-M820anodised lever, painted bodystainless steel clamp bolts Servo Wave Shimano Servo Wave technology optimises the travel of your brake levers. During the braking process, the brake pads are guided quickly to the brake rotor with very short lever travel. The greater part of the lever travel is reserved for the actual braking force. In this way, you can apply your braking power in a more targeted manner and use it more effectively. For brake levers with I-Spec B (as of 2014), there is initially no compatibility with shift levers with the old I-Spec mount. However, these can be made compatible with I-Spec brake levers using I-Spec adapters (SM-SL98-B for XTR, SM-SL78-B for XT and SLX, SM-SL82-B for Saint). 1 x Shimano Saint BL-M820-B brake lever, leftorright

name: Shimano BL-MT501 Brake Lever
description: The BL-MT501 Brake Lever by Shimano - Servo Wave and I-Spec II The Shimano BL-MT501 brake lever has been equipped with Servo Wave technology, i.e. the travel of the 2-finger lever is optimally utilised and the braking force can be well dosed. In addition, the I-Spec II construction is used, which enables the space-saving integration of a compatible shift lever. BL-MT501 has such a slim shape that it does not attract negative attention on the handlebars, but at the same time it is robust enough to be suitable for all-mountain use. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. main cylinder with smooth and robust designslim and stablepowerful, Servo Wavereliable performance - ideal for all riding styles: from Cross Country to TrailI-Spec II compatiblerecommended brake caliper:BR-MT500,BR-MT520funnel venting with M5 funnel (TL-BR003)anodised lever, painted bodystainless steel clamp boltsShimano logo Servo Wave Shimano Servo Wave technology optimises the travel of your brake levers. During the braking process, the brake pads are guided quickly to the brake rotor with very short lever travel. The greater part of the lever travel is reserved for the actual braking force. In this way, you can apply your braking power in a more targeted manner and use it more effectively. I-Spec II I-Spec II describes a variant of the connection between the brake lever and the shift lever on MTB or, more precisely, flatbar gears from Shimano. This type of mount makes for a tidy cockpit as it reduces the number of clamps needed. On some models it is also possible to adjust the shift lever both horizontally and vertically in relation to the brake lever. Then there is 12 mm of adjustment travel in the longitudinal direction and/or up to 15° of rotation - for optimum ergonomic adaptation to your riding style, seat position and anatomy. 1 x Shimano BL-MT501 brake lever, leftorright

name: Shimano 105 Front+Rear Set Disc Brake BR-R7170 + Di2 ST-R7170
description: Shimano 105 Disc Brake Set with BR-R7170 calipers and ST-R7170 Di2 shift/brake levers The disc brake set for the 105 road bike groupset from Shimano consists of two BR-R7170 and two ST-R7170. These are flat-mount brake calipers for front and rear and electronic shift/brake levers that enable wireless 2x or 12-speed shifting and hydraulic braking. The set includes organic brake pads, which contribute to improved heat dissipation with their Ice Tech cooling fins, two brake hoses and connection material. The 105 R7170 disc brake calipers have 10% more brake pad clearance than their predecessor models. This minimises the likelihood of grinding noises and thus results in a quieter braking process. The powerful, excellently controllable braking power ensures reliable deceleration and brings you to a safe stop in all conditions. You also benefit from the user-friendly bleeding process, also known as One-Way Bleeding. With their flat mount design, the two-piece aluminium brake callipers also blend in perfectly with the overall appearance of your bike. By the way, the R7170s do not weigh more than the comparable Ultegra model. The 105 ST-R7170 Di2 shift/brake levers have extended bar end grips at the top for a very ergonomic hold. In addition, you can easily adjust the grip width to your hand size with the help of a 2 mm hex tool. Thanks to the increased braking range and the sensitive lever action, you have full control over all braking processes, and the pressure point is also adjustable. At the same time, the shift/brake levers weigh only about 30 grams per pair more than the Ultegra model. Of course, as before with Dura-Ace and Ultegra, the retreaded Di2 platform is used. This means that the ST-R7170 communicate via a wireless protocol with the rear derailleur, which in turn is wired to the battery and indirectly to the front derailleur. This not only means lightning-fast, highly precise gear changes at the touch of a button. By dispensing with cables on the cockpit, your bike also looks tidier, installation is easier and the shifters and derailleurs are insensitive to dirt at this point. The STIs are powered by button cells that last for several years and can be self-replaced when needed. The brake levers are made of lightweight aluminium, the grip bodies are made of durable composite material. Information on the return and disposal of batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Shift/Brake Lever: * only for pairing via cable or firmware updates, wired shifting is not supported Brake Caliper: Shift/Brake Lever: tidy cockpit, aesthetic look thanks to wireless connectionwireless shifting, precise and fast (rear derailleur / front derailleur with cabling)CR1632 batteries easy to replace with flat head screwdriver, 3.5 to 4 years runtimeunique ergonomics thanks to feedback from professional ridersfunnel venting with M7 funnelfirmware updates via E-Tube Projectanodised brake lever Brake Caliper: 10% larger brake pad spacing minimises grinding of the brake rotor, less noise developmentcoherent appearance and easy tool access thanks to flat mountoptimised heat dissipation with Ice-Techsimple bleeding process2 pistons made of synthetic resinpaintedsteel bolts (4 mm) STI Dual Control Shimano Total Integration (STI) means the combination of braking and shifting functions in one lever, which increases safety when riding. By refining the technology, it became possible to make shifting so smooth at the front and rear that they can be triggered with just one finger. Shimano calls such levers Dual Control Levers (DCL). Digital Integrated Intelligence (Di2) Di2 systems are the electronic shifting systems from Shimano. They are based on the SEIS, the Shimano Electronic Intelligent System, which takes over the index shifting function from the mechanical components, only via power cables or radio signals and not via a Bowden cable. Shifting is done by simply pressing a button. This has the advantage that no great effort is required, your concentration on the ride is not disturbed and operation is easy even with cold hands. In addition, the electronic gear changes are very fast and highly precise. There is also no risk of a defective circuit due to dirty cables or other problems. You can adjust individual settings via the E-Tube Project, such as adjusting the shifting speed, the number of shifting operations per button press or the Synchro or Semi-Synchro shifting function. Shimano offers an app for this purpose. Gear maintenance and firmware updates are also done via E-Tube, with the bike connected to a PC running the appropriate E-Tube software for more extensive workshop work. Semi-wireless The Shimano Di2 12-speed road groupsets in the disc brake version work semi-wirelessly: at the crucial point, namely the interaction between STIs and rear derailleur, the cable is dispensed with, which makes for a tidy cockpit and considerably simplifies assembly. The wireless protocol is extremely fast and reliable, so that the shifting speed reaches a new level - with consistently high precision. Attention was also paid to keeping power consumption as low as possible. Cables are only used between the battery and the rear derailleur and between the battery and the front derailleur. These are thinner than the previous models and easier to lay. Shimano relies on a central battery located in the seatpost. This increases safety and ensures an uncomplicated charging process via the rear derailleur. Once fully charged, the circuit can be ridden for approx. 1000 km. The components are paired together via the E-Tube platform. One Way Bleeding One Way Bleeding is a technique used on Shimano calipers that facilitates brake bleeding. The hose routing has been optimised so that no air bubbles remain in the brake calliper. In combination with the funnel, the brake can be bled cleanly and easily. name: Shimano GRX BR-RX400 + ST-RX400 Disc Brake Set
description: Shimano GRX BR-RX400 + ST-RX400 disc brake set - safety for Gravel specialists The Shimano GRX BR-RX400 + ST-RX400 disc brake set (front + rear) offers you full brake control on off-road terrain and smooth 10-speed shifting thanks to the Dual Control lever. The GRX BR-RX400 brake calipers with flat-mount design - well known and proven in the Road sector - convince with their excellent heat management and simple setup. The GRX ST-RX400 10-speed shift/brake levers are specially designed for Gravel applications, with special lever and grip body ergonomics and anti-slip texture. Thanks to this brake set, you will enjoy riding off-road even more. Are you interested in the GRX series? Then have a look at our Shimano gravel site . You will find many more products there. Shift/Brake Lever: Brake Caliper: Shift/Brake Lever: Dual Control Lever (10-speed) for hydraulic disc brakesGravel-inspired lever and body ergonomicsanti-slip brake lever, paintedmore control on mixed terrainsmooth shifts like the of the best groupsetsfunnel venting with M7 funnelOptislick inner cable with a minimal galvanic coating for more efficient cable routing and corrosion resistanceOT-SP41 housing on grip side (OT-RS900 to rear derailleur) Brake Caliper: excellent heat dissipationpractical tool accesstrouble-free maintenanceeasy to change wheelsclean bleed systemperfect for rough terrainresin pistonspaintedsteel bolts (4 mm) STI Dual Control Shimano Total Integration (STI) means the combination of braking and shifting functions in one lever, which increases safety when riding. By refining the technology, it became possible to make shifting so smooth at the front and rear that they can be triggered with just one finger. Shimano calls such levers Dual Control Levers (DCL). One Way Bleeding One Way Bleeding is a technique used on Shimano calipers that facilitates brake bleeding. The hose routing has been optimised so that no air bubbles remain in the brake calliper. In combination with the funnel, the brake can be bled cleanly and easily. name: Shimano Shift/Brake Lever
description: The 105 ST-R7000 Shift/Brake Lever by Shimano - Refined ergonomics The Shimano 105 ST-R7000 shift/brake lever is a single Dual Control shifter (2-speed or 11-speed) whose redesigned shifting mechanics provide faster, smoother shifts with less lever travel. It is characterised by refined ergonomics and an improved grip feeling, which does not have to hide behind that of comparable Ultegra models. The integrated braking function (Shimano Total Integration Technology) stands for reliable performance in the SLR-EV rim braking system. The extended grip width adjustment also helps control in the cockpit. The ST-R7000 shift/brake lever comes with friction-reducing Optislick shift cable. * with reduced braking force revised shift unit for fast and intuitive shiftingextended reach adjustment (15 mm)Optislick stainless steel inner cable with a minimal galvanic coating for more efficient cable routing and corrosion resistanceOT-SP41 cable housing from lever, OT-RS900 to rear derailleur (not included)SLR-EV brake technologypainted main lever STI Dual Control Shimano Total Integration (STI) means the combination of braking and shifting functions in one lever, which increases safety when riding. By refining the technology, it became possible to make shifting so smooth at the front and rear that they can be triggered with just one finger. Shimano calls such levers Dual Control Levers (DCL). 2-speed: 11-speed: 1 x Shimano 105 ST-R7000 shift / brake lever1 x Shimano shift cable, 1800 mmor2100 mm

description: Entry point into Magura Performance: Magura's MT5 Disc Brake Tried and tested 4-piston technology from motorcycle racing and adapted for cycling, this disc brake set from Magura promises maximum braking power. name: Shimano BL-R780 Brake Levers
description: The BL-R780 brake levers by Shimano - improved linear response technology The Shimano BL-R780 brake levers are designed for Road bikes with straight handlebars, i.e. without drop bars. They are suitable for rim brakes, cantilever brakes, mechanical disc brakes, but also for V-brakes. Both the housing and the 2.5-finger levers are made of lightweight aluminium. The New Super SLR technology improves the controllability of the braking power and the interaction between the transmitter and receiver unit. Suitable brake cables are supplied. name: SRAM Apex 11 11-speed Shift/Brake Lever
description: ergonomic design provides improved grip and better finger feelreach adjustment allows adaptation to personal requirementslever made of durable aluminiumlaser texture for better grip feel SRAM Apex 1x11 drivetrains DoubleTap® DoubleTap® is a technology that simplifies and speeds up the gear change. There is only one fluid motion: a short tap is enough to upshift, and to shift to a lower gear, the lever is simply pushed further down. ErgoDynamics™: Longer brake levers, independent reach adjust for the brake and shift levers, and optimized hood shape give riders of any size comfort and easy access to the controls. Exact Actuation™ For the first introduction of its road bike technologies, SRAM has once again used the proven SRAM MTB 1:1 gear ratio for 10-speed shifting (shifter cable travel : derailleur movement). Exact Actuation™ helps to achieve a simpler and more stable balance between the design of the rear derailleur suspension, tight cog spacing and exact cable tension. The result: a shifting system that is child's play to operate. Reach Adjust: The fit and ergonomics of the brake lever is a very personal matter. Riders have individual position preferences as well as unique hand sizes and finger lengths. With the reach adjustment, the lever can be easily adjusted - for maximum control with just one finger. Zero Loss™ Zero Loss technology ensures that no loss of movement is felt when shifting gears. When a gear is shifted up or down, the cable is triggered immediately, ensuring zero loss of movement. There is no more idle time where you're waiting for the the gear to engage. The gear shift occurs immediately and, above all, precisely. 00.7018.319.000 1 x SRAM Apex Doubletap® shift/brake lever, right

name: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 front+rear set shift/brake levers STI ST-R9250 2-/12-spee
description: Elevate your road cycling experience with our cutting-edge electronic shift system, designed specifically for the demanding road cyclist who seeks precision and reliability. This system boasts a 12-speed cassette, ensuring a broad range of gears for all gradients and speeds. The heart of this system lies in its hydraulic brake mechanism, which provides superior stopping power and modulation compared to traditional mechanical brakes. The brake cables are finely tuned with adjustable reach options, allowing for a personalized and comfortable setup. Crafted from durable steel, the clamp secures firmly onto drop bars, offering a sleek and integrated design. The closed clamp mounting ensures a clean look and easy installation. This electronic shift system not only enhances your performance on the road but also promises a seamless and intuitive riding experience. Whether you're tackling steep climbs or high-speed descents, this system provides the control and confidence you need to push your limits.

name: Shimano SM-BH90-SS Brake Hose for XTR (M9100), Deore, LX, MT520 Brakes
description: The Shimano SM-BH90-SS brake hose - with a straight-straight connection The Shimano SM-BH90-SS brake line is connected straight on both sides - to the brake lever and to the brake caliper. In terms of stiffness, however, it is in no way inferior to the banjo brake lines. It is compatible with XTR M9100, Deore M6000, LX T675 as well as BR-MT520. Like all Shimano brake lines, the SM-BH90-SS can be shortened without any problems. name: SRAM Hydraulic Hose Beveled Banjo for Road Flat Mount
description: The SRAM hydraulic hose with Beveled Banjo for various road flat mount disc brakes This hydraulic hose from SRAM has a bevelled banjo at the end on the lever side and is thus suitable for flat mount road bike brakes with a corresponding connection point in the brake lever. These include the Red, Rival and Force 22, but the Force 1 or CX1 as well as Apex 1 HRD and S-700 are also compatible. The advantage of the system is that the brake hose can be shortened at the brake caliper without having to remove any handlebar tape. You install the banjo at the other end on the side of the brake caliper yourself. Use them with DOT 4 or DOT 5.1 depending on your brake model. The scope of delivery includes connection material including a Torx T8 wrenhc and two Stealth Clips for cable routing, which you can attach to stem bolts. name: Shimano RT-MT900 Center Lock Brake Rotor for XTR w/ Magnet + Internal Teeth
description: The XTR RT-MT900 Brake Rotor with Magnet by Shimano - Cooling technology also for e-bikes The RT-MT900 center lock brake rotor from the XTR series comes with an internally toothed magnetic lockring for the Shimano EW-SS302 speed sensor. Thus, it is suited for e-bikes equipped with a DU-EP800, EP801 or EP600 motor and is intended for use on the rear wheel only. Thanks to FREEZA Ice Technology heat dissipation, the temperatures that occur during braking are significantly reduced, resulting in more consistent braking performance. The service life of the brake pads is also extended. The proven sandwich construction of the RT-MT900 with an aluminium core between two stainless steel layers ensures efficient heat dissipation via the integrated cooling fins, which, unlike the XT version, are painted black. In addition, the 203 mm rotor size offers a considerable weight advantage. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. * not compatible with 203 mm ** only 160 mm *** with BR-S700 and BR-S7000 only organic EW-SS302 speed sensorDU-EP800 / DU-EP800-CRG motorDU-EP801 / DU-EP801-CRG motorDU-EP600 / DU-EP600-CRG motorfor brake pads with narrow pad shapeonly for use on the rear wheel (in combination with e.g. RT-MT900 standard version on the front wheel)lockring with internal teeth: compatible with 10 mm quick releases and 12 mm thru-axles including magnetic lockring (internal toothing) for Shimano speed sensor EW-SS302 for disc brakeperformance indicator: Ultimate (level 3 out of 3)stable and versatile braking performance under the toughest conditionsFREEZA Ice Technology and sandwich construction for even faster heat dissipationheat-diffusing lacquerpainted spider, polished rotorlockring made of anodised aluminiumpainted cooling fins Ice Tech FREEZA Shimano Ice Technologies provide a fast heat dissipation at your disc brake. The brake pads are equipped with aluminium cooling fins. The brake rotor is constructed using a sandwich technique in which stainless steel encloses an aluminium core. The stainless steel on both flanks ensures long durability, the aluminium allows heat dissipation. FREEZA is the further development of the brake rotor, in which additional ribs in the aluminium provide even better heat compensation. This cooling technology creates consistently high performance and longer brake pad durability while reducing fading and brake noise. 1 x Shimano RT-MT900 brake rotor1 x Shimano magnetic lockring for EW-SS302

name: Hope Brake Rotor, Floating 6-Bolt
description: Clever design principle: the Floating brake rotor by Hope The Hope Floating Disc is a float-mounted brake rotor, which is available in numerous diameters and colours. The floating design consists of two parts, an aluminium spider attached to the hub and the actual brake rotor made of stainless steel, which is in contact with the brake pads. When the disc heats up, it expands. However, since it is not rigidly connected to the Spider, but " floating" over riveted joints, it can expand and contract freely without exerting pressure on the Spider. This prevents distortion of the brake rotor. Another advantage of floating rotors is their lower weight compared to standard brake rotors. * Due to the design of the floating brake rotor, a collision between the rivets and the brake caliper can occur with brake calipers from other manufacturers. Please check the clearance before mounting. for performance-oriented driverslaser-cut, heat-treated stainless steel brake surfaceriveted connection to aluminium spiderFloating design is better suited to handling temperature fluctuationsincl. mounting material HBSP330 1 x Hope Floating brake rotor6 x bolts

name: SRAM Paceline Rounded Center Lock Brake Rotor - workshop packaging
description: Elevate your gravel and road cycling experience with the premium SRAM Paceline Rounded Center Lock brake disc, designed specifically for the passionate rider. Engineered with a center lock mounting system, this brake disc ensures a secure and straightforward installation process, allowing you to hit the roads or trails with confidence. The disc is crafted from high-quality stainless steel, offering exceptional durability and reliable performance under various conditions. Complemented by an aluminum spider, it not only reduces the overall weight but also enhances heat dissipation, keeping your brakes cool and efficient during long descents. Compatible with organic brake pads, it promises smooth and responsive braking, giving you the control you need on unpredictable gravel paths or fast-paced road rides. Whether you're upgrading your current setup or building your dream bike, this brake disc is an essential component for any gravel or road cycling enthusiast seeking top-notch performance and reliability.

name: Magura MDR-P 6-bolt Brake Rotor
description: Magura's MDR-P 6-bolt brake rotor withstands the pressure The MDR-P 6-bolt brake rotor from Magura with a two-piece design provides constant braking power, even under permanently high loads. This is achieved thanks to the patented Dovetail Interlink technology, a special interlocking of the outer and inner ring. This provides additional support on the inner ring in the event of thermal expansion of the outer ring. This means that the torque is not transmitted exclusively via the rivets, but over the entire surface, resulting in increased stiffness and direct heat dissipation under continuous load, as occurs in gravity applications. The 220 mm diameter version creates about 10% more braking power than a 203 mm model and 20% more than a 180 mm model. Critical temperatures for the lining are reached much later and the higher mass of the brake rotor reduces the risk of brake fading and reduces pad wear by 15%. The brake rotor is also optimised for e-bike use. Warning: Do not use brake rotor with center lock adapter! Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. Dovetail Interlink Technology A special, patented dovetail of the outer and inner ring offers constant braking performance even under high continuous loads. 1 x Magura MDR-P brake rotor6 x bolts Disc Brake Adapter for 180 mm RotorsDisc Brake Adapter for 203 mm RotorsDisc Brake Adapter for 220 mm Rotors

name: Shimano RT-CL800 Center Lock Brake Rotor for Ultegra w/ Internal Teeth
description: Shimano RT-CL800 Brake Rotor - Ice-Tech FREEZA for Ultegra and other brakes<\/h2>Shimano has developed the RT-CL800 Center Lock brake rotor especially for the Ultegra BR-R8170 road bike disc brake. It is also very suitable for the GRX Gravel brakes. Apart from that, it is also compatible with numerous brake calipers from the MTB sector. The brake rotor features a sandwich construction with an aluminium layer between two stainless steel layers. Thanks to Ice Technologies FREEZA, it provides excellent heat dissipation, even on steep, long descents. In addition, the design has been optimised to keep noise and weight to a minimum. The RT-CL800 comes with a lockring with internal gear teeth, and can be used with both organic and sintered brake pads.

name: Shimano RT-MT900 Center Lock Brake Rotor for XTR / Dura-Ace w/ Internal Teeth
description: The XTR and Dura-Ace RT-MT900 Brake Rotor by Shimano - Optimised in every respect The Shimano RT-MT900 brake rotor was designed and developed on the basis of the successful Ice Tech FREEZA rotors. In the 140 mm and 160 mm versions, which are aimed particularly at road bike and cross-country riders, a weight reduction of 5 and 10 g respectively has been achieved. The 180 mm and 203 mm versions, specially designed for Enduro riders, are characterised by further improved heat dissipation and are, of course, also weight-optimised. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. * not compatible with 203 mm (BR-R9170-R also not compatible with 180 mm) ** only 140 and 160 mm *** with BR-S700 and BR-S7000 only organic for brake pads with narrow pad shapelockring with internal teeth: compatible with 9/10 mm quick release and 12 mm thru-axlefor 15 mm and 20 mm thru-axles, use theSM-HB20lockring instead performance indicator: Ultimate (level 3 out of 3)stable and versatile braking performance under the toughest conditionsrevised Ice Technologies FREEZA design for even faster heat dissipationheat-diffusing lacquer140 and 160 mm optimal for road and cross country in terms of low weight180 and 203 mm optimal for Enduro in terms of heat dissipationlacquered spider, polished rotor, lockring made of aluminium, anodised (internal gear teeth) Ice Tech FREEZA Shimano Ice Technologies provide a fast heat dissipation at your disc brake. The brake pads are equipped with aluminium cooling fins. The brake rotor is constructed using a sandwich technique in which stainless steel encloses an aluminium core. The stainless steel on both flanks ensures long durability, the aluminium allows heat dissipation. FREEZA is the further development of the brake rotor, in which additional ribs in the aluminium provide even better heat compensation. This cooling technology creates consistently high performance and longer brake pad durability while reducing fading and brake noise. 1 x Shimano RT-MT900 brake rotor1 x lockring

name: Shimano RT-MT905 6-bolt Brake Rotor for XTR
description: The Shimano XTR RT-MT905 Brake Rotor - Ice-Tech FREEZA for 6-bolt disc brakes The RT-MT905 is Shimano's first 6-bolt brake ritir with Ice-Tech FREEZA technology. The proven sandwich construction with aluminium core and stainless steel jacket is supplemented by a specially-coated rib structure in the aluminium, which ensures even faster heat dissipation. This means you can rely on constant braking power even in extreme use. Thanks to the surface temperature being lowered by at least 100 degrees compared to conventional stainless steel brake rotors, fading and brake noise are reduced and the service life of the brake pads is also extended. RT-MT905 was developed for XTR brake systems, but is also compatible with numerous other models from the MTB, gravel and road bike segments. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. * not compatible with 203 mm ** with BR-S700 and BR-S7000 only organic for brake pads with narrow pad shape FREEZA Ice Technology and sandwich construction for even faster heat dissipationheat-diffusing lacquersuperior braking performance, durability and control even in the most demanding riding conditionssignificantly lower surface temperature for higher performance and less fading with less brake noise and longer pad lifeanodised spider, polished rotorwith self-locking plates Ice Tech FREEZA Shimano Ice Technologies provide a fast heat dissipation at your disc brake. The brake pads are equipped with aluminium cooling fins. The brake rotor is constructed using a sandwich technique in which stainless steel encloses an aluminium core. The stainless steel on both flanks ensures long durability, the aluminium allows heat dissipation. FREEZA is the further development of the brake rotor, in which additional ribs in the aluminium provide even better heat compensation. This cooling technology creates consistently high performance and longer brake pad durability while reducing fading and brake noise. 1 x Shimano RT-MT905 brake rotor6 x Shimano fixing screws3 x Shimano lock washers

name: Intend BC Skinny 6-Bolt Brake Rotor
description: Unlock Your Ride's Potential with the Skinny 6-hole brake rotor from Intend Experience better breaking performance on your next All Mountain, Cross Country, Enduro, or MTB adventure with the Skinny 6-hole brake disc from Intend. Designed to cater to the most demanding terrains, this 1-piece steel brake rotor is not just about durability; it's about transforming your ride. Its compatibility with sintered, organic, and semi-metallic brake pads ensures you can customize your braking experience to match your riding style and the conditions you face. The 6-bolt mounting system offers a secure and straightforward installation. Whether you're navigating steep descents or tackling technical trails, the precision and control provided by this brake disc will boost your confidence and performance. Plus, its steel construction doesn't just promise longevity; it guarantees a consistent and reliable braking power trip after trip. Upgrade to the Skinny 6-hole brake disc and feel the difference in your ride's responsiveness and safety, no matter where your wheels take you.

name: Intend BC Massive 6-hole brake disc
description: Get ready to elevate your MTB, Enduro, Dirtjump, Slopestyle, or Downhill rides with the Massive 6-hole brake disc from Intend BC, a top-notch choice for those who demand reliability and performance. Crafted from durable stainless steel, this 1-piece brake disc is designed to withstand the most challenging conditions and ensure you have the stopping power when you need it the most. Its 6-bolt mounting system makes installation a breeze, allowing you to get back on the trail faster. Whether you're shredding down a mountain or hitting big air, this brake disc is built to keep up with your adventurous spirit. The sleek design not only looks great but also contributes to its superior braking efficiency, reducing the risk of overheating even during intense braking sessions. Perfect for riders who push their limits, it offers a blend of strength, performance, and reliability that's hard to beat. Upgrade your ride with the Massive 6-hole brake disc and experience the difference in your bike's braking capability. Say goodbye to compromised performance and hello to smooth, reliable stops every time you hit the brakes. This is the upgrade your bike deserves for the ultimate riding experience.

name: Shimano TL-BR Professional Bleed Kit
description: Shimano Professional Bleed Kit TL-BR for proper bleeding of disc brake systems The TL-BR professional bleed kit contains all the necessary parts for proper bleeding of Shimano hydraulic disc brake systems, both for the brake caliper and for the brake levers. It includes the TL-BR001 bleed syringe, which is securely connected to the bleed nipple or bleed socket on the brake calliper via the supplied hose and a clamp. Also included is the TL-BR003 oil funnel for brake levers with M5 connection, as mainly found in MTB and touring use. For road bike shift/brake grips with M7 connection, the funnel TL-BR002 is part of the scope of delivery. You also get four bleed blocks that are compatible with various 2-piston and 4-piston models and serve as spacers after removing the brake pads. Only mineral oil is not supplied. syringe with increased volume and smooth operationreliable and clean hose connectionclip prevents leakage, dripping and oil leakage during bleedingfunnel for attachment to BL type brake levers (M5)funnel for attachment to ST type brake levers (M7)four spacers for different brake calipers Y-13098630 Shimano TL-BR Professional Bleed Kit, consisting of: 1 x Shimano TL-BR001 bleed syringe1 x Shimano TL-BR002 oil funnel for ST brake levers1 x Shimano TL-BR003 oil funnel for BL brake levers1 x hose with bleed nipple1 x hose clip2 x funnel feet2 x funnel lids2 x oil stoppers4 x bleed blocks Shimano Mineral Oil

name: Shimano TL-BR003 Funnel Bleed Kit for BL Brake Levers
description: Shimano Funnel Bleed Kit TL-BR003 for MTB type BL brake levers with M5 connection The TL-BR003 funnel bleed kit contains all parts that have to be used for bleeding newer Shimano disc brake systems with brake levers of the BL type on the master cylinder side. These brake levers are common in MTB and touring use and have a bleed screw with an M5 thread. The TL-BR003 oil funnel is fitted directly here after removing the O-ring. Occasionally, for example in the city bike segment, there are also ST brake grips with M5 connections, so the set can also be used there. The funnel impresses with its generous volume and is made of durable, robust plastic. The kit also includes a cap and an oil stopper to prevent mineral oil from escaping during the bleeding process. name: Shimano BR-R451 Rim Brake
description: The BR-R451 rim brake by Shimano - compatible with 32 mm tyres The Shimano BR-R451 rim brake is a Road side-pull brake without group integration, designed according to the dual pivot principle, i.e. it has two joints. This brake system reduces loss of friction in the brake caliper, brake lever and inner cable. name: Shimano 105 BR-R7000 Rim Brake Set
description: Shimano 105 BR-R7000 Rim Brake Set - Strong- and not too heavy The Shimano 105 BR-R7000 rim brake set puts brake performance, stiffness and weight in an optimal relationship. name: SRAM Rim brake
description: Upgrade your road bike's braking performance with the SRAM Force AXS road caliper brake. Designed specifically for road cycling, this brake is made from durable aluminum, ensuring a lightweight yet robust addition to your setup. The brake operates via a brake cable, offering you precise and responsive braking control, perfect for tight turns and quick stops. Its mechanical design makes it easy to install and maintain, fitting seamlessly onto your bike's brake mount. Whether you're an avid racer or enjoy leisurely rides, this road caliper brake is the ideal choice for improving your cycling experience. Enjoy the confidence of reliable stopping power on every ride.

name: SRAM S-900 Direct Mount Rim Brake
description: The S-900 rim brake is the first brake with Direct Mount standard from SRAM. But it represents more than the mere completion of the product portfolio for road bike brakes. Their design ensures a more efficient transmission of power from the lever to the brake flank, providing consistent modulation of the braking force and fast lever return. The generous tyre clearance means that modern wide tyres up to 28C are no problem. Finding the right brake lever is just as easy, because the S-900 is compatible with all non-hydraulic SRAM road bike brake levers, including the levers from the SRAM RED eTap® series. front: direct fork mountrear: mounting directly on the seatstayefficient design for more braking power and modulationlarge tyre clearance increases compatibility with modern wide wheels and tyressolid feel and quick reset for a direct braking sensation 1 x SRAM S-900 rim brake, (front or rear)1 pairs of brake pads for carbon rimsincl. mounting material

description: The Chorus 12s rim brake set by Campagnolo - safe, powerful braking performance The Chorus 12s rim brake set from Campagnolo offers powerful but modular braking performance that provides a high level of control. This way, braking can be applied with the appropriate intensity needed for any situation. The special brake pad compound further improves power, dosing and noise level.
