name: Shimano GRX RX820 2x12 31-48 Groupset
description: With the Shimano GRX RX820 2x12-speed groupset, you can master any challenge The Shimano RX820 is a gravel-specific 2x12-speed groupset with a 31-48 tooth gradation at the front and an 11-34 or 11-36 tooth cassette at the rear. The set-up with two chainrings is suitable for all those who want to combine the flexibility of conventional road bike gears with off-road capability. The gear ratio has been chosen so that you can always pedal smoothly. You are fast on the flat and make good progress on climbs, no matter what the terrain is like. In keeping with the slogan " Undroppable" , you never get dropped and master every challenge. In any case, you will benefit from the reliability, durability and performance of the GRX RX820. With this groupset, Shimano has once again expanded the range of its gravel components to reflect the spirit, individuality, sense of freedom and community of gravel enthusiasts. The groupset also includes two shift/brake levers, a front derailleur, a rear derailleur, a Quick-Link chain and flat-mount disc brakes. conventional Shimano Road freehubs name: Shimano GRX RX810 2x11 31-48 Groupset
description: With the Shimano GRX RX810 2x11 groupset you can discover new things The Shimano GRX RX810 2x11 groupset is the result of two years of close collaboration with Gravel enthusiasts from around the world. It consists of a 2x crank (31-48 T), front derailleur, rear derailleur, disc brake with Di2 shift lever left and right, chain and cassette. Shimano didn't want to tell the Gravel specialists what to ride, but asked them what they wanted instead. Many unpaved paths were explored, off-road races contested, bikepacking tours undertaken, a lot of dust swallowed and mud bath galore. The result is the world's first Gravel-specific component groupset, the GRX by Shimano. Are you interested in the GRX series? Then have a look at our Shimano gravel site . You will find many more products there. The bottom bracket is not included. name: SRAM Rival 1 Wide XPLR 1x12-speed 40 eTap AXS Groupset
description: The SRAM Rival 1 eTap AXS groupset with gravel-oriented XPLR components and Wide chainline gives beginners a headstart into the world of electronic 1x12-speed shifting with 10 to 44 teeth in the rear and 40 teeth in the front. The hydraulic disc brakes are mounted via flat mount. To keep you in control even on bumpy surfaces, the shift/brake levers have rubberised levers and the surface of the rubber grips is textured. Its eTap shifting logic is intuitive: you shift up on one side, down on the other. With AXS, you save yourself the hassle of cable routing the rear derailleur and can use the app to adjust the shifting behaviour to your requirements if you wish. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . cassette compatible with SRAM XDR The bottom bracket is not included. name: SRAM Apex 1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x12-speed Groupset
description: The SRAM Apex 1 groupset with 1x12-speed shifting, Wide and XPLR components and electronic AXS equipment for gravel enthusiasts This electronic SRAM Apex 1 AXS 1x12-speed groupset with " Wide" chainline and XPLR gradation is recommended for use on gravel bikes. It includes crankset, rear derailleur, disc brakes, cassette and chain. The " Wide" chainline is shifted slightly to the outside, giving you a high degree of tyre clearance. The XPLR cassette with 11 to 44 teeth for Shimano Road freehubs has the right gear for you even in difficult terrain. The hydraulic disc brakes are mounted via flat mount. To keep you in control even on bumpy surfaces, the shift/brake levers and the surface of the rubber grips are textured. Its eTap shifting logic is intuitive: you shift up on one side, down on the other. With AXS, you save yourself the hassle of cable routing the rear derailleur and can use the app to adjust the shifting behaviour to your requirements if you wish. name: Shimano GRX Di2 RX827 Group 1x12 / 42
description: Unleash the full potential of your gravel riding experience with the latest Shimano GRX Di2 RX827 groupset 1x12 / 42, designed to elevate your adventure on every terrain. This cutting-edge system features a 12-speed electronic, wireless shifting mechanism, ensuring smooth, precise gear changes with the mere touch of a button. Powered by a durable lithium battery, you can rely on consistent performance ride after ride. The GRX series is specifically tailored for gravel applications, offering unmatched control and versatility. Its advanced disc brakes are hydraulic and adhere to the Flat Mount standard, promising superior stopping power in all conditions. Embrace the freedom of wireless technology and the confidence of robust disc brakes, all integrated into one seamless package. Whether you're tackling rugged backcountry roads or cruising on mixed surfaces, the GRX series is your ultimate companion for exploration and adventure. Get ready to push the boundaries of where your bike can take you, with technology that's as relentless as your spirit of adventure.

name: SRAM Force E1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x13-speed group
description: Unleash the power of cutting-edge cycling technology with the SRAM Force E1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x13 speed groupset, designed to elevate your gravel biking experience to unprecedented levels. This high-performance setup features a 13-speed electronic, wireless shifting system, ensuring seamless gear changes with the mere touch of a button. Powered by a durable lithium battery, you'll enjoy long-lasting, reliable performance on even the most challenging terrains. The disc brake system, with its flat mount caliper mounting, offers superior stopping power and control, allowing you to tackle steep descents and sharp turns with confidence. Whether you're grinding through gravel or embarking on long-distance adventures, this setup's hydraulic disc brakes ensure consistent, efficient braking in all conditions. With its focus on gravel applications, this series promises to deliver both speed and stability, making every ride an exhilarating adventure. Embrace the future of gravel cycling with the Force series, where innovation meets the rugged demands of off-road exploration.

name: SRAM Rival E1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x13-speed group
description: Unleash the power of cutting-edge cycling technology with the SRAM Rival E1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x13 speed groupset, tailor-made for the gravel enthusiast seeking unparalleled performance. This marvel of engineering features a state-of-the-art 13-speed shifting system, operating on a flawless electronic and wireless platform, ensuring that you're always in the right gear with the mere touch of a button. Powered by a durable lithium battery, the Rival promises long-lasting reliability and swift, responsive shifts on even the most demanding terrains. The disc brake system, compatible with Flat Mount calipers, offers unmatched stopping power and control, allowing you to tackle steep descents and slippery surfaces with confidence. Designed specifically for gravel riding, this series combines robustness with sophistication, providing a seamless integration of technology and cycling prowess. Whether you're grinding through gravel or speeding over mixed surfaces, the Rival series ensures a smooth, efficient, and exhilarating ride every time. Embrace the future of cycling with a system that's wireless, efficient, and ready to elevate your gravel adventures to new heights.

name: SRAM Red XPLR E1 Wide AXS 1x13-speed Groupset
description: The SRAM Red XPLR E1 Wide AXS groupset for an electronic 1x13-speed gravel drive The Red XPLR E1 Wide AXS 1x13-speed complete groupset from SRAM with Red XPLR E1 rear derailleur, cassette, crankset, and hydraulic disc brakes with flat mount mounting makes your gravel bike ready for any terrain. The drive is wirelessly controlled and ensures precise, quick gear changes, while the hydraulic disc brakes not only look good but also perform powerfully. The full-mount direct mounting is the most striking feature of the rear derailleur: it is mounted directly on the rear axle instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. This keeps it precisely and without tolerances aligned, even when used in challenging terrain. The cassette has 13 sprockets with 10 to 46 teeth and offers a gear range of 460%, ideal for sprints on asphalt, tours over gravel, or climbs in the mountains. The crank arms made of carbon promise high stiffness at a low weight. The chainring is attached via Thread Mount and can be easily replaced with the appropriate tool if necessary. The grips are designed for different hand sizes and shapes and can be adjusted in grip width and contact point to your needs. With the help of the AXS app, you customize your drive and configure the two additional buttons on the sides of the shift/brake levers.

name: SRAM Force E1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x13-speed Power Meter Group
description: Unleash the power of cutting-edge cycling technology with the SRAM Force E1 Wide XPLR AXS 1x13 speed Powermeter group, designed specifically for the gravel enthusiast who refuses to compromise on performance. This marvel of engineering features a 13-speed electronic, wireless shifting system that promises seamless gear changes on even the most challenging terrains. The disc brakes are hydraulic and adhere to the Flat Mount standard, ensuring unmatched stopping power and reliability when you need it most. Powered by a robust lithium battery, this system is not just about performance but also about endurance, keeping you going on long, adventurous rides. The Force series is the epitome of innovation, combining the convenience of wireless technology with the precision of electronic shifting to give you an unparalleled riding experience. Whether you're tackling steep climbs, fast descents, or technical gravel paths, this system provides the control and confidence you need to push your limits. Get ready to experience gravel cycling like never before, with a system that's as relentless and adventurous as you are.

name: Campagnolo Ekar 13-speed 40 Groupset w/ Disc Brake
description: The Campagnolo Ekar 13-speed groupset comprises a crankset with a 40-tooth chainring, a cassette for the innovative N3W freehub, a rear derailleur and a chain with 118 links. A disc brake with flat-mount brake callipers and Ergopower shift/brake handles is also included. Pro Tech bearing cups are not included. Choose from threaded bearing cups (BSA/ITA) or Pro Tech Pressfit bearing cups . AFS Center Lock brake rotors are not included. A flat mount disc brake adapter for 140/160 mm front brake rotors is not included. The brake calliper bolts for the rear disc brake are not included in the scope of delivery. These must be selected according to the thickness of the chainstay and purchased separately. name: SRAM GX Eagle AXS 1x12-speed Upgrade Kit
description: The SRAM GX Eagle AXS 1x12-speed Upgrade Kit - Electronic shifting for beginners The SRAM GX Eagle AXS upgrade kit allows mountain bikers to cost-effectively switch to electronic shifting on 1x12-speed drivetrains without sacrificing functionality. You get a GX Eagle AXS rear derailleur with battery and charger, a matching GX Eagle AXS shifter with two programmable shift buttons and an adjustment gauge. The rear derailleur has a robust steel cage and shifts quickly and precisely even under load. With Overload Clutch, it stays protected in the event of hard hits. The Controller shifter has two control surfaces that you can access without loosening your grip on the handlebars. Both the rear derailleur and controller can be personalised using the AXS app, so you can set your preferred shifting behaviour. You can also read the battery level not only on the rear derailleur itself, but also in the app. Doesn't your bike look a lot tidier without shift cables? Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. Rear Derailleur: Shifter: Eagle cassette Rear Derailleur: derailleur pulley bearings made of steelOverload Clutch protectionwith battery cover as optical highlight and for protection against stone chips Shifter: operates with CR2032 batteryvariable mounting options of the controller to clamp or MatchMaker X thanks to multi-positionwith ANT+ interfacetwo touch points AXS™: AXS is SRAM's electronic integration platform that combines electronic bicycle components and software. The SRAM AXS app allows you to view battery status, change component behaviour, adjust controls, receive maintenance reminders and update firmware. Overload Clutch: In case of an impact against the rear derailleur, the motor decouples to give the rear derailleur a maximum of movement and returns to its original position after the impact. Roller Bearing Clutch™: Rear derailleurs with Roller Bearing Clutch are equipped for rough and demanding terrain. Unimpressed by a ground full of roots, stones or rocks, the technology ensures a stable rear derailleur and prevents beating chains. The rear derailleur thus offers maximum drive stability without compromising on precision or performance. Cage Lock™: Thanks to the rear derailleur's Cage-Lock technology, the chain and the rear wheel can be fitted and removed really easily. Simply release the chain tension by pushing the shift cage forward and locking it. MatchMaker X Integrated: The MatchMaker-X clamp is more than just a clamp. It is a wonder of tidyness. With room for up to three controls on each clamp, you can mount everything from your XLoc damper lock, SRAM switches and Avid brake levers to the Reverb XLoc remote, all in just two clamps, so you have everything within reach. 1 x SRAM GX Eagle AXS rear derailleur1 x SRAM GX Eagle AXS Controller shifter1 x SRAM battery1 x SRAM battery cover1 x SRAM charger1 x USB cable for charger1 x SRAM chain gap adjustment gauge

name: SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB Groupset for Brose
description: The XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset by SRAM for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on trail and enduro e-bikes with Brose motor This SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for an electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on an e-mountain bike with Brose motor unit. You get two crank arms, a chainring, an electronically controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the XX series for all-mountain trails and enduro race tracks. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. Via the Magic Wheel, the lower derailleur pulley, the chain simply continues to run if a branch or something similar gets in the way. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The XS-1297 cassette has one aluminium and eleven steel sprockets and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The crank arms are made of carbon with a foam core and are therefore light and stiff. The 36-tooth chainring is precisely matched to T-type chains, as are the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys. The XX chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. It is particularly durable and features a hard chrome finish and weight-saving hollow pins. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. Motor: Brose motor with ISIS interface and Brose Direct Mount chainring mountFrame: UDH universal derailleur hanger requiredFreehub: SRAM XDRear Over Locknut Dimension: 148 mm thru-axle (Boost) Not compatible with Specialized Levo Gen3. mountain bike groupset for wireless shifting on e-mountain bikes with Brose motormounting the rear derailleur directly on the wheel axle instead of a derailleur hangersmooth shifting under full loadcassette with 52, 44 and 38 teeth as largest sprockets (instead of 52, 42 and 36 on Eagle) for more consistent gear shiftinglargest sprocket made of aluminium, others made of steelcarbon crank arms with foam core, with ISIS interfacechain with hollow pins and hard chrome finishrear derailleur with Magic Wheellightweight, ergonomic shift controller with two shift buttonsuse the AXS app for simplified setup, fine tuning and more55 mm chainline 00.7918.280.000 SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB complete groupset for Brose, comprising of: 2 x SRAM XX Eagle Transmission E-MTB crank arms1 x SRAM T-Type chainring1 x SRAM XS-1297 cassette1 x SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS rear derailleur1 x SRAM eTap / AXS battery1 x SRAM AXS Ultimate controller with CR2032 battery1 x SRAM XX Eagle Transmission chain1 x SRAM PowerLock T-Type master link1 x SRAM battery charger1 x SRAM clip-on guard for chainring

name: SRAM GX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB Groupset
description: SRAM's GX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on e-mountain bikes This SRAM GX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for a reliable electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on an E-MTB with a mount for a four-arm chainring with 104 mm bolt circle diameter. You get a chainring, an electronically controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the entry-level GX series for enduro, all-mountain and cross-country use. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. The AXS POD controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The sprockets of the XS-1275 cassette are partly made from a single block, partly assembled. With 10-52 teeth, it offers a wide range whose gear steps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-Sync design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The crankset with robust aluminium arms has a Direct Mount chainring with 34 teeth. Like the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys, this is precisely matched to T-Type chains. name: SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB Groupset
description: The XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset by SRAM for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on trail and enduro e-mountain bikes This SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for an electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on an e-mountain bike with a mount for a four-arm chainring with 104 mm bolt circle diameter. It includes a chainring, an electronically-controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the XX series for all-mountain trails and enduro racing. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. Via the Magic Wheel, the lower derailleur pulley, the chain simply continues to run if a branch or something similar gets in the way. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The XS-1297 cassette has one aluminium and eleven steel sprockets and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The 34-tooth chainring is precisely matched to T-type chains, as are the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys. The XX chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. It is particularly durable and features a hard chrome finish and weight-saving hollow pins. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. name: SRAM X0 Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB group
description: SRAM's X0 Eagle Transmission AXS groupset for a durable 1x12-speed electronic drivetrain on e-mountain bikes This SRAM X0 Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for a robust, electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on an E-MTB with a mount for a four-arm chainring with 104 mm bolt circle diameter. It includes a chainring, an electronically-controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the durability-oriented X0 series for enduro, all-mountain and cross-country use. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The XS-1295 cassette is nickel-plated to improve durability. It has one aluminium and eleven steel sprockets and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The 34-tooth chainring is precisely matched to T-type chains, as are the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys. The X0 chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. It scores with high durability thanks to solid pins and a corrosion-preventing PVD coating. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. name: SRAM NX Eagle 1x12-speed E-Bike Upgrade Kit with Cassette
description: The SRAM NX Eagle 1x12-speed E-Bike Upgrade Kit with Cassette for Shimano freehub is the entry-level set for your E-MTB This SRAM NX Eagle series upgrade kit with cassette for hubs with Shimano freehub allows beginners to use 1x12-speed drivetrains on e-bikes off-road. It consists of an NX Eagle rear derailleur, a specific NX Eagle Trigger Single Click shifter for E-MTBs, a PG-1230 cassette and a PC NX Eagle chain. Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. The colour designation consists of the colour of the cassette in the first place and series and colour of the chain in the second place. name: SRAM GX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB Groupset for Bosch
description: The GX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset from SRAM for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on e-mountain bikes with Bosch motor This SRAM GX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for a reliable electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on an E-MTB with Bosch motor unit. You get two crank arms, a chainring, an electronically controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the entry-level GX series for enduro, all-mountain and cross-country use. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. The AXS POD controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The sprockets of the XS-1275 cassette are partly made from a single block, partly assembled. With 10-52 teeth, it offers a wide range whose gear steps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-Sync design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The crankset with robust aluminium arms has a Direct Mount chainring with 36 teeth. Like the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys, this is precisely matched to T-Type chains. The GX chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. With its solid, chrome-plated pins, it proves to be reliable and durable. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings.

name: SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed E-MTB Groupset for Bosch
description: The XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset by SRAM for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on trail and enduro e-bikes with Bosch motor This SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for an electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on an e-mountain bike with Bosch motor unit. You get two crank arms, a chainring, an electronically controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the XX series for all-mountain trails and enduro race tracks. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. Via the Magic Wheel, the lower derailleur pulley, the chain simply continues to run if a branch or something similar gets in the way. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The XS-1297 cassette has one aluminium and eleven steel sprockets and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The crank arms are made of carbon with a foam core and are therefore light and stiff. The 36-tooth chainring is precisely matched to T-type chains, as are the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys. The XX chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. It is particularly durable and features a hard chrome finish and weight-saving hollow pins. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Before you replace components on your e-bike, please read through the guidelines for component replacement for CE-marked e-bikes/pedelecs with pedal assistance. name: SRAM Eagle Transmission 1987 Collection AXS 1x12-Speed Groupset
description: With the Eagle Transmission group from SRAM’s 1987 Collection, you get the proven technical advantages for your All Mountain, Cross Country or Enduro bike – in a limited edition. A key feature of Eagle Transmission is the direct-mount electronic derailleur, which is installed without a traditional derailleur hanger – instead, it mounts directly onto the UDH (Universal Derailleur Hanger) interface. As such, this group is only compatible with frames that support UDH. This direct-mount design results in a precise, play-free alignment of the derailleur, enabling seamless interaction between cassette and shifting. There’s no need for adjustment or limit screws. The derailleur is also built to be extremely durable, easily withstanding impacts from all directions, so you can keep riding even after a crash. With the included AXS Pod Ultimate controller, you can manage your shifting with ease while on the go. X-SYNC technology ensures outstanding shifting performance even under heavy load. Thanks to cassette mapping, gear changes occur along specially designed shift ramps, delivering an exceptionally smooth transition. The crankset is made of durable aluminum arms and features a direct-mount chainring, available with 32 or 34 teeth. Both the chainring, cassette, and pulley wheels are specially matched to T-Type chains. The X0 inspired chain stands out with its distinctive Flattop profile, reminiscent of road chains, but specifically developed for the Eagle Transmission system. With the integrated power meter, you can precisely analyze your rides and fine-tune your training. If you’re looking for a unique upgrade for your bike, this transmission group is the perfect match – cutting-edge technology wrapped in timeless design.

name: Shimano XT 1x11-speed Upgrade Kit
description: The XT 1x11 Upgrade Kit by Shimano - Upgrading made easy The Shimano XT 1x11 upgrade kit is just the thing for you if you want to switch from 10-speed to 1x11-speed. It consists of an 11-speed cassette (11-42 or 11-46 t), a Quick-Link chain, a rear derailleur and a shifter for the right-hand side. Here you have the choice between clamp mounting, I-Spec (B) and I-Spec II. The Shimano XT 11-speed shifting system guarantees an efficient gear range, smooth gear changes and riding fun in every scenario, be it cross-country racing or all-mountain use. 1 x Shimano XT CS-M8000 cassette1 x Shimano XT RD-M8000 Shadow+ short rear derailleur1 x Shimano Ultegra / XT CN-HG701 chain1 x Shimano XT SL-M8000 shifterorSL-M8000-B-Ior(SL-M8000-I mm, right)1 x Shimano cable, 2050 mm1 x Shimano 1880 mm cable housing1 x covers for gear indicators (clamponly)1 x Shimano aluminium cassette lockring1 x Shimano SM-CN900-11 Quick-Link master link3 x Shimano 6 mm sealed end caps1 x Shimano long nose end cap

name: Shimano XT 1x12-speed Upgrade Kit
description: The Shimano XT Upgrade Kit - Your entry into the 12-speed world The Shimano XT 1x12 Upgrade Kit enables all those who do not ride a Shimano crank to enter the world of 12-speed shifting with Shimano. It includes the rear derailleur RD-M8100, the shifter SL-M8100-R, the chain CN-M8100 and the cassette CS-M8100-12 in the gradation 10-45 or 10-51 t. With the rear derailleur you can choose between clamp and I-Spec EV mounts. name: SRAM Eagle 90 DUB T-Type MTB Group 1x12-speed
description: With the Eagle 90 DUB T-Type MTB 1x12-speed groupset, you upgrade your mountain bike to the latest technology. It is perfect for those looking for a lightweight yet durable groupset. Featuring Full Mount derailleur architecture, just like its AXS Transmission counterparts. The repairable derailleur body, outer and inner parallelogram links, skid plates, and the tool-free removable derailleur cage assembly can all be replaced.Another special feature of the Eagle Transmission is its shifting performance under load, which is made possible in the Eagle 90 groupset thanks to the XS-1275 T-Type cassette in combination with the specific T-Type Transmission shifter.Last but not least, the sleek yet robust crankset, made from forged aluminum, deserves special mention. It comes equipped with a Direct Mount T-Type chainring, ensuring top performance.

name: Shimano SLX 1x11-speed Upgrade Kit
description: The SLX 1x11 Upgrade Kit by Shimano - Upgrading was never so well-priced With the Shimano SLX 1x11-speed upgrade kit you can switch from a 10-speed to a 1x11-speed drivetrain without having to spend too much money. It includes a cassette (11-42 or 11-46 t), a chain (Quick-Link), a rear derailleur and a shifter for the right-hand side, where you have the choice between clamp, I-Spec B and I-Spec II mounting. For the " mid-range" SLX series, high-quality technologies, an elegant appearance and durability are just as self-evident as for the top groupsets - but paired with an unbeatable price advantage that opens up new possibilities for trail adventures and recreational mountain biking. name: SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed Groupset
description: The XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset by SRAM for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on trail and enduro bikes This SRAM XX Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the main components for an electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on a mountain bike. You get a crankset, an electronically-controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the XX series for all-mountain trails and enduro race tracks. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. Via the Magic Wheel, the lower derailleur pulley, the chain simply continues to run if a branch or something similar gets in the way. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The XS-1297 cassette has one aluminium and eleven steel sprockets and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The crankset is lightweight and stiff thanks to the carbon arms with foam core and is combined with a Direct Mount chainring with 32 teeth. Like the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys, this is precisely matched to T-Type chains. The XX chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. It is particularly durable and features a hard chrome finish and weight-saving hollow pins. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . Frame: UDH universal derailleur hanger requiredFreehub: SRAM XDRear Over Locknut Dimension: 148 mm thru-axle (Boost) The bottom bracket is not included. name: SRAM XX SL Eagle Transmission AXS 1x12-speed Groupset
description: The XX SL Eagle Transmission AXS groupset by SRAM for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on a cross-country bike This weight-optimised SRAM XX SL Eagle Transmission AXS groupset provides the most important components for an electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on a mountain bike. You get a crankset, an electronically-controlled rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the XX-SL series designed for low weight for cross-country use. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. Via the Magic Wheel, the lower derailleur pulley, the chain simply continues to run if a branch or something similar gets in the way. To reduce weight, the XX SL rear derailleur is equipped with a carbon cage. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The lightweight XS-1299 cassette has three sprockets made of aluminium and eight made of steel and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. The crank is particularly light and stiff thanks to hollow carbon arms and is combined with a Direct Mount chainring with 34 teeth. Like the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys, this is precisely matched to T-Type chains. The XX SL chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. The outer flaps contain recesses to reduce weight. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . It's a must-have for riders seeking to push their limits and enjoy the ultimate off-road cycling experience.

name: Shimano XTR Di2 M9220 group 1x12
description: Elevate your mountain biking experience with the latest Shimano XTR Di2 M9220 1x12 Groupset, designed for the adrenaline-fueled All Mountain, Enduro, and MTB riders. This cutting-edge setup features a 12-speed electronic, wireless shifting system, ensuring seamless gear changes and optimal performance on even the most challenging terrains. The trigger-style shift lever, compatible with I-Spec EV, offers precise control right at your fingertips. With hydraulic disc brakes mounted via Postmount, you can expect exceptional stopping power and reliability, allowing you to tackle steep descents and technical trails with confidence. The system is powered by a durable Lithium battery, highlighting the blend of traditional cycling mechanics with modern electronic innovation. This setup is not just about performance; it's about pushing the boundaries of what's possible on a bike, offering riders an unparalleled experience on the trails. Whether you're an experienced enduro racer or a passionate mountain biker seeking the next level of performance, the XTR series is your gateway to a whole new world of cycling excellence.

name: SRAM XX SL Eagle Transmission AXS Power Meter 1x12-speed Groupset
description: The XX SL Eagle Transmission AXS groupset by SRAM with power meter for an electronic 1x12-speed drivetrain on a cross-country bike This weight-optimised SRAM XX SL Eagle Transmission AXS groupset for an electronic, wireless 1x12-speed drivetrain on the mountain bike is equipped with a power meter spider for power measuring. You get a power meter crank, an electronic rear derailleur with AXS controller, a cassette and a chain, all from the XX-SL series designed for low weight for cross-country use. One of the special features of the Eagle Transmission is a derailleur hanger-free mounting of the electronic rear derailleur, which is mounted instead of the UDH universal derailleur hanger. The use of this groupset is therefore only possible on frames with this derailleur hanger. Direct mounting results in exact, tolerance-free alignment of the rear derailleur and an unprecedented harmony of rear derailleur and cassette. Adjustment bolts and limit screws are not required. In addition, the rear derailleur is designed to be extremely tough, so that it can easily withstand impacts from all sides and you can continue riding without any problems after a fall. Via the Magic Wheel, the lower derailleur pulley, the chain simply continues to run if a branch or something similar gets in the way. To reduce weight, the XX SL rear derailleur is equipped with a carbon cage. The AXS Pod Ultimate Controller can be mounted on the left or right side. The XS-1299 cassette has three sprockets made of aluminium and eight made of steel and offers a wide range with 10-52 teeth, whose gear jumps have been optimised compared to Eagle cassettes. The X-SYNC design enables outstanding shifting performance even and especially under full load. Thanks to cassette mapping, the gear changes take place along designated shift ramps, which makes the process extremely smooth. Thanks to hollow carbon arms, the power meter crank is particularly light and stiff and impresses with its innovative design. It includes a spider with power measurement on both sides, which is very accurate with only +/- 1.5% deviation, and a thread-mount chainring with 34 teeth. Like the cassette sprockets and derailleur pulleys, this is precisely matched to T-Type chains. The XX SL chain has a special flattop design reminiscent of road chains, but specially designed for Eagle Transmission. The outer flaps contain recesses to reduce weight. A battery for the rear derailleur and a charging device are included. Use the groupset together with the AXS app to set it up, fine-tune the shifting behaviour and make and view other settings. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . name: Shimano Deore XT Di2 M8250 Shifting Upgrade Kit
description: With the new Shimano Deore XT Di2 M8250 shifting upgrade kit for your MTB, you get an innovative wireless shift lever and a modern electronic 12-speed rear derailleur with a short cage. This upgrade delivers precise and fast gear changes that truly shine on all-mountain, cross-country, and enduro rides. The closed-design trigger clamp ensures seamless integration on the handlebar and offers intuitive operation. Thanks to the advanced lithium battery, you benefit from long-lasting power and reliable performance. Whether you're navigating technical terrain or speeding along fast trails, this XT-series upgrade takes your ride dynamics to the next level. Experience the freedom of wireless shifting and focus entirely on the trail ahead.

name: Shimano SLX M7100 group 1x12 34
description: The Shimano SLX M7100 1x12 groupset - like an old friend This SLX M7100 groupset from Shimano consists of a 1x12-speed crank with 34-tooth chainring, a rear derailleur and a right-handed shifter, whereby you have the choice between clamp and I-Spec EV mounting. It also includes a Quick-Link chain and a cassette with 10-45 or 10-51 gradation. The Shimano SLX M7100 groupset never lets you down. Whether it's an epic all-day adventure, the local Cross Country race, or the after-work lap with your buddies, you can take it anywhere, anytime. Born from the same DNA as its big Shimano siblings XTR and XT, it delivers quality and performance at a unique level to passionate mountain bikers. The bottom bracket is not included. Shimano recommends BB-MT801 (BSA) or BB-MT800-PA Pressfit Hollowtech II. The TL-FC41 Chainring Installation Tool is also not included. The Shimano SLX M7100 1x12 groupset includes: 1 x Shimano SLX crank (FC-M7100-1)1 x Shimano 34 tooth chainring (SM-CRM75)1 x Shimano SLX Shadow Plus rear derailleur (RD-M7100orRD-M7120)1 x Shimano SLX shifter (SL-M7100-RorSL-M7100-IR)1 x Shimano SLX cassette (CS-M7100-12)1 x Shimano SLX chain (CN-M7100)1 x Shimano crank bolt1 x Shimano crank lockring1 x Shimano aluminium cassette lockring1 x Shimano SM-CN910-12 Quick-Link master link1 x Shimano cable (2050 mm)1 x Shimano cable housing (1880 mm)3 x 6 mm sealed end caps1 x long nose end cap

name: Shimano 105 Di2 R7150 Groupset 2x12 34-50
description: The Shimano 105 Di2 R7150 2x12-speed Groupset - It's a new day The R7150 is the first 105 groupset with electronic shifting. Shimano has also extended its " Science of Speed" to the more affordable series compared to Dura-Ace and Ultegra and equips it with the retreaded, semi-wireless Di2 platform. This works without cables at the crucial point, namely in the interaction between STIs and rear derailleur. Cables are only used between the battery and the rear derailleur or front derailleur. The wireless protocol is extremely fast and reliable, which raises the shifting speed to a new level - with consistently high precision. That's not all: this 105 groupset is also the first with twelve rear gears, so you have a wider gear selection and are optimally prepared for any terrain. Conveniently, the 105 12-speed cassettes are also compatible with older Shimano road freehubs. Combined with the advanced disc brake system, the R7150 lets you experience every day on a road bike anew and discover the street as a space of endless possibilities. The 105 Di2 R7150 Road groupset by Shimano consists of a 2x12-speed crank with 34-50 tooth gradation, a flat mount disc brake set and an electronic rear derailleur and front derailleur for semi-wireless shifting. Of course, a rechargeable battery, a Quick-Link chain and a cassette with 11-34 teeth are also included. Information on the return and disposal of batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . battery mounting internally in the seatpost (adapter required), running time approx. 1000 kmtwo CR1632 batteries in each STI for wireless shiftingfront derailleur connected to battery via cablerear derailleur with wireless chip, LED display, charging socket and function button, connected to battery via cablecassette with wide gear range for any terrain10% more free space for the brake pads reduces noise development The following components are still required for the semi-wireless operation of the 105 Di2 R7150 groupset: Bottom Bracket: Shimano recommendsSM-BBR60orSM-BB72-41B PressfitHollowtech II.2 x brake rotors (140, 160 or 180 mm), recommended:SM-RT70,SM-RT642 xEW-SD300-Ipower cables: 1 x from battery to front derailleur (max. 1500 mm) and 1 x from battery to rear derailleur (max. 1700 mm)*recommended: rubber grommets for internal cable routingif necessary, FM-to-FM brake adapterSM-MA-R160 D/Dfor 160 mm brake rotor with 140 mm FM frame orSM-MA-R160 D/Dfor 180 mm brake rotor with 160 mm FM frameif necessary, brake caliper mounting bolts for 10/15/20/30/35 mm frame diameter (Type CandType C2) * To determine the correct cable lengths, the bike must be measured as follows: Distance between battery and front derailleurDistance between battery and rear derailleur = distance between battery and bottom bracket + distance between bottom bracket and rear derailleur You can find more information in the Shimano manual or contact our service staff. name: Shimano Ultegra Di2 R8150 Groupset 2x12
description: With the Ultegra Di2 R8150 groupset from Shimano, you’ll reach the pinnacle of road performance and benefit from the technologies of the top-tier Dura-Ace series – but in a more affordable package. The electronic semi-wireless shifting system delivers precise and lightning-fast gear changes, making your ride more efficient. Thanks to the 12-speed cassette, you get a wide range of 11-34 teeth with finely spaced gears. Shimano has eliminated the need for cable routing between the shifters and derailleur – only one wire remains between the battery and the derailleur or front mech, providing a clean look and simple installation. With powerful hydraulic disc brakes, you’ll enjoy maximum control and safety at all times – whether the weather turns or the descents get long. The flat-mount design ensures the brakes integrate seamlessly into the sleek profile of your road bike. Upgrade to the Ultegra R8150 and experience top-tier technology on your favorite loop.

name: Shimano 105 R7100 2x12 34-50 Groupset
description: The Shimano 105 R7100 2x12-speed complete groupset - pure road cycling with first-class mechanics With the 105 R7100, Shimano presents a mechanical 2x12-speed groupset for road bikes for the first time. Purist in design, it brings premium technology, high-precision function and unadulterated shifting pleasure to anyone who simply wants to ride a road bike, regardless of battery charge levels and firmware updates. The " Science of Speed" , which has already made Dura-Ace and Ultegra so powerful, is presented here at a particularly attractive price. The wide gear range lets you find the right gear for all occasions, whether you are riding on the flat or want to conquer mountains. You also benefit from perfect lever ergonomics and excellent braking performance thanks to disc brakes. The groupset includes a crank with 34- and 50-tooth chainrings, a cassette with 11-34 teeth, a braze-on front derailleur, a rear derailleur, a Quick-Link chain, two STIs and flat-mount brake calipers. name: Shimano Dura-Ace Di2 R9250 Groupset 2x12
description: With the Dura-Ace Di2 R9250 groupset from Shimano, you’ll achieve the highest level of shifting performance and benefit directly from the same technology used by professionals. The electronic semi-wireless system delivers ultra-fast and precise gear changes, significantly boosting your efficiency on the bike. The 12-speed cassette offers a wide gear range of 11-34 teeth while maintaining finely tuned steps. Shimano has eliminated cable routing between the shifters and derailleur – only a single wire remains between the battery and the rear or front derailleur, ensuring a tidy appearance and simple installation. The hydraulic disc brakes provide maximum control and safety at all times – even in poor weather or on long descents. With their sleek flat mount design, the brakes blend seamlessly into your road bike’s look. Upgrade to the Dura-Ace Di2 R9250 and experience cutting-edge technology with every kilometer of your training ride.

name: SRAM Force AXS HRD 2x12 groupset + Hammerhead Karoo
description: Discover the SRAM Force AXS HRD 2x12 groupset including the Hammerhead Karoo – the next generation of road cycling performance. Featuring our hydraulic disc brakes and revolutionary 12-speed drivetrain – fully wireless and electronic for seamless integration and unmatched efficiency. This state-of-the-art technology offers you precise control and exceptional braking power in all conditions, thanks to the flat mount design that ensures a clean look and low aerodynamic drag. The use of lithium batteries guarantees long life and reliable performance, so you can stay focused on the ride. Whether you're chasing speed or comfort, our Force series system gives you the flexibility and performance you need to push your limits. With wireless technology, it eliminates cable clutter and allows for quick and easy installation. On top of that, this set includes a Hammerhead Karoo cycling computer to perfectly complement your system.

name: Shimano 105 R7000 group 2x11 34-50
description: The 105 R7000 2x11 Groupset by Shimano - Rise to the challenge The Shimano 105 R7000 2x11 groupset benefits directly from the technologies of its big sisters, the Dura-Ace and the Ultegra, and reliably supports road bike beginners in training and competitions. The groupset includes a crankset with 2 chainrings (34-50 T), an 11-speed cassette (11-30, 11-32 or 11-34 T), a Quick-Link chain, rear derailleur, braze-on front derailleur, a shift/brake lever pair (STI) and a set of rim brakes. With the R7000 - available in black and silver like its predecessors - you'll be more motivated than ever to take on challenges. The bottom bracket is not included. Shimano recommends SM-BBR60 (BSA/ITA) or SM-BB72-41B Pressfit Hollowtech II. The Shimano 105 R7000 2x11 groupset includes: 1 x Shimano 105 crankset (FC-R7000)1 x Shimano 105 rear derailleur (RD-R7000)1 x Shimano 105 front derailleur (FD-R7000)1 x pair Shimano 105 STI 2-/11-speed shift / brake levers (ST-R7000)1 x pair Shimano 105 rim brakes (BR-R7000)1 x Shimano 105 cassette (CS-R7000)orCS-HG700-11 (11-34)1 x Shimano 105 / SLX Quick-Link chain (CN-HG601-11)1 x Shimano crank bolt1 x Shimano OT-RS900 240 mm cable housing1 x extended end cap for rear derailleurs1 x Shimano shift cable, 1800 mm1 x Shimano shift cable, 2100 mm2 x brake cables2 x brake cable housings3 x shifter cable housings6 x caliper bolts for rim brakes2 x pairs R55C4 brake pads1 x Shimano steel cassette lockring1 x Shimano 1.85 mm cassette spacer for road freehub (onlyfor 11-34)1 x Shimano SM-CN900-11 Quick-Link master link

name: Shimano Ultegra Di2 R8150 power meter group 2x12 with disc brake
description: Gear up for the road with the Ultegra Di2 R8150 power meter group 2x12 with disc brake from Shimano, designed specifically for road cycling. This high-end groupset brings you the cutting-edge in cycling technology with its electronic, semi-wireless 2-speed and 12-speed shifting, ensuring smooth and precise gear changes every time. The disc brakes, featuring a sleek Flat Mount caliper mounting, offer superior stopping power and control, no matter the weather conditions. The hydraulic disc brake system is engineered for optimal performance, giving you confidence on steep descents and during high-speed pursuits. With the Ultegra series, you're getting a combination of durability, lightweight design, and efficiency, making every ride better than the last. Whether you're training for your next race or enjoying a long ride on the weekend, this groupset will elevate your road cycling experience. Its semi-wireless shift system not only provides a clean aesthetic but also reduces the hassle of managing cables, allowing for a more streamlined setup. Embrace the future of cycling with the Ultegra Di2 R8150 power meter groupset, and feel the difference in your pedal stroke with its integrated power meter, designed to help you train smarter and ride harder. Get ready to push your limits and achieve new personal bests with this top-tier groupset tailored for the avid road cyclist.

name: SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM groupset 2x12-speed 35-48
description: Discover the latest highlight for your road bike, the SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM 2x12-speed 35-48 groupset. With its hydraulic disc brake in flat mount design, it delivers not only maximum braking power and precision on the road but also enhanced safety on every descent and in every turn. The 12-speed drivetrain is the heart of this system, operating fully wirelessly to offer you unparalleled freedom and comfort when shifting. Thanks to electronic control, gear changes are lightning-fast and extremely precise, allowing you to fully focus on the road. The 2x crankset supports you on any terrain—from steep climbs to fast flats. Power is supplied by a high-performance lithium battery that guarantees long life and reliability. With this high-tech equipment, you’re perfectly equipped for long rides and demanding races on asphalt. Switch to the next generation of cycling technology and experience how the Rival series revolutionizes your road cycling.

name: SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM Group 2x12-speed 33-46
description: Introducing the SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM groupset 2x12-speed 33-46 Electronic Wireless Shift System, a cutting-edge solution for road cyclists seeking unparalleled control and performance. This system revolutionizes your ride with its advanced 12-speed electronic, wireless shifting, ensuring seamless gear changes and a smoother cycling experience. Designed for the road, it features a state-of-the-art 2-speed shifting mechanism that caters to your need for speed and precision. The disc brake system, with its hydraulic Flat Mount calipers, promises reliable stopping power in all conditions, enhancing your safety and confidence on the road. Powered by a durable lithium battery, this system guarantees long-lasting performance and minimal maintenance. Its sleek design integrates seamlessly with your bike, maintaining aesthetics while boosting functionality. Whether you're a competitive racer or a passionate enthusiast, the Rival Series Electronic Wireless Shift System is your key to unlocking a new level of cycling performance.

name: SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM Powermeter Group 2x12-speed 33-46
description: Discover the next generation of cycling technology with the state-of-the-art SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM Powermeter 2x12-speed 33-46 groupset, equipped with an advanced 2x12-speed electronic wireless shifting system that offers you a seamless and precise shifting experience. The hydraulic disc brakes with flat mount installation ensure reliable braking performance, even on demanding terrain. Powered by a high-performance lithium battery, it provides long-lasting energy supply that won’t let you down on long rides. This combination of advanced technology and thoughtful design makes it the perfect companion for all your road adventures. The Rival series stands for quality and performance you can feel on every ride.

name: SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM Powermeter Group 2x12-speed 35-48
description: Discover the next generation of cycling technology with the state-of-the-art SRAM Rival E1 AXS HRD FM Powermeter 2x12-speed 35-48 groupset, equipped with an advanced 2x12-speed electronic wireless shifting system that offers you a seamless and precise shifting experience. The hydraulic disc brakes with flat mount installation ensure reliable braking performance, even on demanding terrain. Powered by a high-performance lithium battery, it provides long-lasting energy supply that won’t let you down on long rides. This combination of advanced technology and thoughtful design makes it the perfect companion for all your road adventures. The Rival series stands for quality and performance you can feel on every ride.

name: SRAM Force E1 AXS HRD FM group 2x12-speed 33-46
description: Unleash the power of cutting-edge cycling technology with the SRAM Force E1 AXS HRD FM group 2x12-speed 33-46, a pinnacle of innovation designed for the road. This marvel of engineering features a wireless, electronic 12-speed shifting system, ensuring seamless gear changes with the mere touch of a button. Paired with a 2-speed setup, it offers unparalleled control and efficiency for any road challenge. The hydraulic disc brakes, adhering to the Flat Mount standard, promise unmatched stopping power and reliability in all weather conditions. Powered by a robust lithium battery, this system guarantees long-lasting performance, keeping you ahead without the worry of frequent recharges. Its application on the road is where it truly shines, offering cyclists a blend of speed, precision, and endurance. With the Force series, experience the future of cycling where technology meets the tarmac, elevating your ride to levels previously unimagined.

name: Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed 34-50 Groupset
description: Chorus 12s 12-speed 34-50 groupset by Campagnolo - for versatile individualists The Chorus 12s groupset from Campagnolo represents another top-performing drivetrain made up of high-quality and versatile products. The popular Chorus model has been expanded to 12-speed in the Chorus 12s. The unbeatable price/performance ratio was taken into account and retained. In other respects, the traditional Italian company has made no compromises in expanding to a 12-speed groupset. With 24 gears, there is a suitable gear ratio for every incline. The Ergopower shift grips are extremely ergonomic and easy to use, so that you can shift up and down quickly. Despite one more sprocket, the cassette requires the same space as an 11-speed cassette. For this, the thickness of the chain had to be reduced, but this does not detract from its performance and reliability. Well-tried and yet high-end: the Dual Pivot brakes offer maximum braking power and ideal dosing without having to forego the practical mounting option of the brake and the simple adjustment of the shift cable. Ultra Torque™ bearing cups are not included. You can choose from threaded (BSA/ITA) or Pressfit cups. The Campagnolo Chorus 12s groupset includes: 1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s Ultra Torque 12-speed crankset, incl. left & right bearings (pressed)1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed rear derailleur1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 2-/12-speed front derailleur, braze-on1 pair of Chorus Ultra-Shift 12s Ergopower shift/brake levers1 pair of Campagnolo Chorus 12s rim brakes, front & rear1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed cassette1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed chain2 x shift cables (2000 mm and 1600 mm)3 x shift cable housings (2 x 680 mm & 330 mm)2 x brake cables (front/rear, 2000 mm)2 x brake cable housings (580 mm and 1250 mm)3 x end caps

name: Shimano Group
description: Shimano 105 R7000 2x11 Disc Brake Groupset - Derived technologies With the Shimano 105 R7000 2x11 disc brake groupset, 105 riders now also benefit from the reliable, constant braking force of a group-specific disc brake. Likewise, the other technologies are directly derived from the higher-level series Dura-Ace and Ultegra. The groupset consists of a 2x crankset (34-50 T), an 11-speed cassette (11-30, 11-32 or 11-34 T), a rear derailleur, a braze-on front derailleur, a Quick-Link chain and the ready-to-install disc brake set with two flat mount brake calipers and shift/brake levers (STI). Road bike beginners, hobby cyclo-crossers or gravel lovers will appreciate the advantages of the modernised 105 groupset - like its predecessors available in black and silver. The bottom bracket is not included. name: SRAM Rival eTap AXS HRD FM Group 2x12-speed 33-46
description: The Rival eTap AXS HRD FM Groupset for a 2x12-speed drivetrain with a gradation of 33-46 The SRAM Rival eTap AXS groupset with a combination of 33 and 46 teeth in the front offers you a cost-effective solution for an electronic 2x12-speed drivetrain for your road bike. The cassette allows for even gear graduations, and the variant up to 36 teeth opens up a wide range for you. The hydraulic disc brakes are mounted via flat mount. For optimal grip, the shift/brake levers are rubberised and the grips have a textured surface. Its eTap shifting logic is intuitive: you shift up on one side, down on the other. Pressing both levers at the same time operates the front derailleur. AXS allows you to spare wiring the rear and front derailleur, and the matching app allows you to personalise your electronic groupset on-the-go and adjust it as needed. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . cassette compatible with SRAM XDR The bottom bracket is not included. SRAM recommends DUB Road Bottom Brackets . Also brake rotors are not included. all components for electronic shiftingeasy personalisation with SRAM AXSsimple and intuitive eTap shifting logicwide range with 10-36 teethdirect, precise shiftingquiet operation thanks to narrow, efficient Flattop™ chainshift/brake handles with textured shift paddles and rubber gripscrank with proven DUB technologyfluid gear shifts thanks to 13-tooth gradation at the front and even gradation at the rearlarge X-Sync shift rollers for high durability and efficiency SRAM Rival eTap AXS HRD FM 2x12-speed 33-46 groupset, consisting of: 1 x SRAM Rival DUB 2x12-speed crankset1 x SRAM XG-1250 cassette1 x SRAM Rival 12-speed chain1 x SRAM PowerLock master link1 x pair SRAM Rival eTap AXS HRD shift/brake levers1 x pair SRAM Rival eTap AXS disc brakes (flat mount), filled and bled, ready for installation2 x pairs SRAM organic brake pads1 x SRAM brake hose, 950 mm (front)1 x SRAM brake hose, 1800 mm (rear)1 x SRAM Rival eTap AXS rear derailleur1 x SRAM Rival eTap AXS front derailleur2 x SRAM eTap / AXS battery1 x SRAM battery charger1 x SRAM mounting bolt for the front derailleur1 x SRAM washer for the front derailleur3 x SRAM adapter wedge for front derailleur1 x front derailleur bolt2 x SRAM pad spacers2 x SRAM bleed block2 x Jagwire S-hooks2 x inserts2 x olives1 x T8 Torx key1 x SRAM chain gap adjustment gauge

name: Shimano Group
description: The 105 R7000 2x11 Groupset by Shimano - Even more motivation in training The Shimano 105 R7000 2x11 groupset is the right equipment for road bike beginners and ambitious bike amateurs, because it benefits directly from the technologies of the superior Dura-Ace and Ultegra series. Whether in training or competition, the 105 is at your side. Contents includes a crankset with two chainrings (36-52 T), an 11-speed cassette (11-28, 11-30 or 11-32 T), a Quick-Link chain, rear derailleur, braze-on front derailleur, a shift/brake lever pair (STI) and a set of rim brakes. With the R7000 - available in black and silver like its predecessors - you'll be more motivated than ever to take on challenges. The bottom bracket is not included. Shimano recommends SM-BBR60 (BSA/ITA) or SM-BB72-41B Pressfit Hollowtech II. name: SRAM Red E1 AXS HRD FM Groupset 2x12-speed 37-50
description: The SRAM Red E1 AXS HRD FM groupset for a 2x12-speed road drivetrain with a gradation of 37-50 teeth With the Red 1 E1 Aero AXS HRD FM groupset from SRAM with Red E1 2x12-speed drivetrain, crankset with a gradation of 37-50 teeth, carbon arms and hydraulic disc brakes with flat-mount attachment, you can fully equip your road bike. The drivetrain is controlled wirelessly and ensures precise, fast gear changes, while the hydraulic disc brakes not only look good, but are also powerful. The shift/brake levers are designed for different hand sizes and shapes and can be adapted to your needs in terms of reach and contact point. You can use the AXS app to customise your drivetrain and configure two additional buttons on the sides of the levers. Information on the return and disposal of used batteries and electrical equipment can be found here . The bottom bracket is not included. SRAM recommends DUB Road Bottom Brackets . Brake rotors are not included either. groupset with wireless 2x12-speed road drivetrain and hydraulic disc brakelightweight crank with carbon arms and 37-50 tooth gradationfast and precise rear derailleur with Orbit dampingfront derailleur with automatic trim and Yaw cage technologyhydraulic road disc brakes with shift/brake leversefficient Flattop chain with 126 links and PowerLock master linkdiscreet design with polished brake callipercarbon brake leveroptimised handle shape for secure grip of different hand sizescarbon lever blade for weight saving, 83 g lighter than its predecessorbite point and reach adjustmenteasy personalisation with SRAM AXSDUB bottom bracket system for durability and simplicitypower supply of the shifter for communication with the rear derailleur via a CR2032 battery AXS AXS is SRAM's electronic integration platform that combines electronic bicycle components and software. The SRAM AXS app allows you to view battery status, change component behaviour, adjust controls, receive maintenance reminders and update firmware. Reach Adjust The fit and ergonomics of the brake lever is a very personal matter. Riders have individual position preferences as well as unique hand sizes and finger lengths. The grip width adjustment makes it child's play to adjust the lever - for maximum control. Bleeding Edge Bleeding Edge technology allows quick and easy bleeding of the brakes. Due to the special fluid channel and the improved bleed opening, the fluid can be pumped more easily through the brake calliper. A special adapter can be fitted to the bleed port and seals the system to prevent air ingress and fluid loss. Stealth-a-majig With Stealth-a-majig, installing the hydraulic hose during assembly is child's play. Its smaller size allows easy internal cable routing, which gives the bike a tidy look. DUB The unit of crankshaft and bottom bracket is the heart of the DUB technology. Stiffness meets durability. SRAM has gone a step further and made everything even easier and better. It is mainly the system approach through the integration of chainring, crank, spindle and bottom bracket that means better drivetrain performance. X-Range The X-Range technology was developed with the possibilities of today's dropbar bikes in mind. It is distinguished by a broad gear range with smooth, even gear changes. The combination of chainrings with 13-tooth spacing with a high bandwidth cassette, starting with a 10-tooth sprocket, ensures well thought-out, homogeneous gear jumps and always puts you in the right gear. In combination with AXS, you can make various shift settings and personalise your drivetrain to suit you. X-Sync The X-Sync tooth design is characterised by long, rounded and slanted tooth edges with a narrow profile. Derailleur pulleys with X-Sync technology support the chain guide and remain unaffected by dust and mud. Orbit Orbit technology is an innovative form of rear derailleur movement control. It uses silicone fluid as part of an elegant and ultralight damper system. Compared to a conventional friction clutch system, the Orbit technology generates no additional resistance at the rear derailleur spring during slow or light movement. This results in easier shifting and removal of the rear wheel. During the ride, the liquid damper holds the chain back in a sophisticated and elegant way. With the highest reliability and chain tension, for 2x and 1x systems. Yaw The Yaw technology allows trim-free shifting, as the front derailleur cage describes an arc and is therefore at a constant angle to the chain. Shifting transitions are thus more direct and precise, providing unprecedented performance when shifting up front. SRAM Red E1 AXS HRD FM 2x12-speed 37-50 groupset, consisting of: 1 x SRAM Red E1 AXS DUB 2x12-speed Carbon crankset, 37-50 gradation1 x SRAM Red XG-1290-E1 12-speed cassette1 x SRAM Red E1 12-speed PowerLock chain, 126 links1 x SRAM PowerLock master link2 x SRAM Red E1 AXS HRD disc brakes, filled and bled, ready for installation2 x SRAM Red E1 AXS HRD shift/brake lever with battery1 x SRAM Red E1 AXS rear derailleur1 x SRAM Red E1 AXS 2x front derailleur2 x pair SRAM organic brake pads2 x SRAM brake hose, 950 mm (front)and1800 mm (rear)1 x SRAM pad spacer1 x SRAM bleed block2 x washers2 x SRAM eTap / AXS battery1 x SRAM battery charger Optional accessories: SRAM eTap AXS Wireless Blips Satellite Shiftersdisc brake adapters

name: SRAM Force AXS HRD 2x12 groupset
description: Unleash the power of cutting-edge cycling technology with the SRAM Force AXS HRD 2x12 Group set, a marvel designed for the road and crafted for speed and precision. This bike is equipped with a state-of-the-art wireless shift system, allowing for seamless 12-speed electronic shifting that promises a ride as smooth as it is fast. The disc brakes, featuring a hydraulic Flat Mount system, offer unmatched stopping power, ensuring safety and control in every situation. Powered by a robust lithium battery, this bike is not just about mechanical excellence but also incorporates the latest in electrical device advancements for a truly modern cycling experience. The Force series is tailored for those who demand the best in both performance and technology on the road. Whether you're sprinting to the finish line or embarking on a long, challenging ride, this bike delivers unparalleled efficiency and reliability. Get ready to experience the future of cycling today with the Force series.

name: Campagnolo Chorus 12s group 12-speed 36-52
description: Chorus 12s 12-speed 36-52 groupset by Campagnolo - for versatile individualists The Chorus 12s groupset from Campagnolo represents another top-performing drivetrain made up of high-quality and versatile products. The popular Chorus model has been expanded to 12-speed in the Chorus 12s. The unbeatable price/performance ratio was taken into account and retained. In other respects, the traditional Italian company has made no compromises in expanding to a 12-speed groupset. With 24 gears, there is a suitable gear ratio for every incline. The Ergopower shift grips are extremely ergonomic and easy to use, so that you can shift up and down quickly. Despite one more sprocket, the cassette requires the same space as an 11-speed cassette. For this, the thickness of the chain had to be reduced, but this does not detract from its performance and reliability. Well-tried and yet high-end: the Dual Pivot brakes offer maximum braking power and ideal dosing without having to forego the practical mounting option of the brake and the simple adjustment of the shift cable. Ultra Torque™ bearing cups are not included. You can choose from threaded (BSA/ITA) or Pressfit cups. The Campagnolo Chorus 12s groupset includes: 1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s Ultra Torque 12-speed crankset, incl. left & right bearings (pressed)1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed rear derailleur1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 2-/12-speed front derailleur, braze-on1 pair of Chorus Ultra-Shift 12s Ergopower shift/brake levers1 pair of Campagnolo Chorus 12s rim brakes, front & rear1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed cassette1 x Campagnolo Chorus 12s 12-speed chain2 x shift cables (2000 mm and 1600 mm)3 x shift cable housings (2 x 680 mm & 330 mm)2 x brake cables (front/rear, 2000 mm)2 x brake cable housings (580 mm and 1250 mm)3 x end caps

name: Shimano 105 R7000 group 2x11 34-50 with direct mount (rear dropout)
description: The Shimano Ultegra R7000 2x11 Direct Mount groupset with direct mount rim brakes The Shimano 105 R7000 2x11 Direct Mount groupset differs from a standard road bike groupset because of the rim brake. The brake set is designed for direct mounting on the frame or fork, with the rear wheel version being mounted on the chainstays. This provides more aerodynamics and an integrated appearance. The groupset also comes with a 2-speed crank (34-50 T), an 11-speed cassette (11-30, 11-32 or 11-34 T), a Quick-Link chain, a braze-on front derailleur, a pair of shift/brake grips (STI) and a rear derailleur. As usual, the 105 benefits directly from the technologies of its bigger sisters, the Dura-Ace and the Ultegra, and provides reliable service to road bike beginners in training and competition. The bottom bracket is not included. Shimano recommends SM-BBR60 (BSA/ITA) or SM-BB72-41B Pressfit Hollowtech II.
